To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more drinks like beer and soda for resale, and will help Jane to generate greater profits so as to meet family costs. Jane hopes that in the future she will be able to have the biggest bar with better service. 

Jane is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jane who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock more drinks like beer and soda for resale.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 28 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children. For the past year, Isaac has been working hard to manage his video library, which sells film and music video DVDs. 

To help expand his business, Isaac has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a machine to produce classy music, and will help Isaac to generate greater profits and increase stock. With the loan, he will be able to provide better service that will increase profits so he can meet other expenses. Isaac hopes that in the future he will be able to own a bigger video library that will produce good local and international music. 

Isaac is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Isaac who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy a machine to produce classy music and increase stock.

loans.name: Asaeli

texts.en:
Asaeli is 43 years old, married to Marceline, and blessed with three children. He runs a hotel, a business he started 10 years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000.

He has requested for a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase 15 liters of cooking oil, baking flour, and maize flour, three bales each, for use in the cafeteria.

The profit he makes will aid him in paying his loan and expand his business. His dream is to see his business grow big. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase 15 liters of cooking oil, baking flour, and maize flour, three bales each.

loans.name: Donatien

texts.en:
Donatien is married with two children. He has been a rice farmer for 7 years, and his wife also works as a farmer. He would like this Kiva loan so he can buy seeds and pay for labor to get the best harvest. With his profits, he plans to expand the farming area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for rice production labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise (rice, noodles, and tuna, among others)

loans.name: El Lirio Group

texts.es:
Maria Santa es otro de los integrantes del grupo el lirio, ella tiene la edad de 39 años, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar y esta casada con el señor Vicente con el cual tiene dos hijos. Doña Maria Santa platica que desde hace 10 años tuvo la inquietud de trabajar para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar asi que abrió una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, ella dice que le gusta mucho su negocio ya que no le quita mucho tiempo y así no descuida a su familia. Ella este muy contenta ya que con ele paso de los años ha hecho muchos clientes los cuales acuden a hacerle el gasto, apesar de que su tienda es pequña esta muy bien surtida para que sus clientes siempre encuentren lo que buscan y no vallan a otros negocios, su negocio le ha enseñado a su familia el trabajo en equipo ya que entre todos se turnan para atenderlo. ella invertira este credito en la  compra  aceite, comida enlatada, frijoles, arroz, refrescos, dulces, sabritas, pan dulce, galletas, sal , azucar , mayonesa, jabon y cloro para resurtir su negocio. 

ella desea que con esta inversion su negocio gane mas clientes para que sus ganancias aumenter y poder ofrecer a sus hijos mas estudios y una mejor calidad de vida.

los demas integrantes del grupo son:
Celia venta de ropa 
Irma venta de pollo 
Laura venta de pollo 
Felipe renta de sillas
Maria del carmen Venta de comida 
Emmanuel refaccionaria 
Ernesto venta de comida
texts.en:
María Santa is another member of the “Lirio” (Lilly) group.  She’s 29 years old and did not have the opportunity to attend school.  She’s married to Vicente and they have two children.  

María Santa relates that ten years ago she was anxious to go to work to help her husband with household expenses so she opened a little grocery store.  She says that she likes her business very much because it doesn’t require too much of her time and she doesn’t neglect her family.  She’s very happy that as time has passed she’s acquired many customers who come by to make their purchases.  Despite the store being small, it’s very well stocked so that her customers always find what they are looking for and won’t have to go to other stores.  Her business has taught her family teamwork because they all take turns tending to it.  She will use the loan to buy oil, canned food, beans, rice, soft-drinks, candy, Sabritas [brand of snacks], sweet bread, cookies, salt, sugar, mayonnaise, soap and chlorine bleach to stock her store.

She hopes with this investment that her store will acquire more customers so that her profits will increase and she will be able to offer her children more schooling and a better quality of life.

The rest of the group members are:

Celia – sells clothes 
Irma – sells chicken 
Laura – sells chicken 
Felipe – chair rental
María del Carmen – food sales 
Emmanuel – tire repair shop 
Ernesto – food sales

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
This is Leticia, 54, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is single and manages her own household while operating her business. She works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Leticia operates a business selling biscuits, cookies, and dried fish that she purchases from wholesalers. Customers are attracted to her low prices and variety of products. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, Leticia is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy supplies to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Leticia hopes to be able to develop her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of biscuit supplies and products needed in her business

loans.name: Donath

texts.en:
Donath is married with two children, aged three and six, both of whom are enrolled in school. Donath has been a rice farmer for 12 years, and his wife also works as a farmer. He would like this Kiva loan so he can buy seeds and pay for labor to get a better harvest. With his profits, he plans to expand the farming area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and rice production labor.

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
Las divinas es un grupo integrado por  11 personas, el cual esta ubicano en una zona cañera y su gente se dedica al corte, siembra de caña y al trabajo en el ingenio productor de azucar que se ubica en la comunidad.

Omar es uno de los integrantes del grupo tiene 33 años, solo estudio la primaria y es soltero,vive con su familia en la comunidad de Vicente.  El platica que siempre ha trabajado para salir adelante, pero desde hace un año puso una pequeña taqueria en su casa  en un pequeño corredore que tiene enfrente, el realiza sus ventas los fines de semana(viernes, sabado y domingo) como ya tiene algun tiempo vendiendo ya tiene sus clientes los cuales acuden hacerle el gasto .

omar invertira este credito en la compra de carne, tortillas, col, rabanos, variedad de chiles, cebolla, tomates, aceite, gas y refrescos para la elaboracion de su venta.

el espera que con este credito su negocio continue creciendo ya que sus ganancias las piensa invertir en la compra de sillas y mesas.

los demas integrantes del grupo son:

ilse venta de zapatos
Griselda venta de comida
diana venta de carne
Zoila venta reposteria
Irma venta de cosmeticos 
Marcelina venta de antojitos mexicanos 
Teofila venta de carne 
Jesica farmacia 
Minerva venta de carne
Miguel venta de abarrotes
texts.en:
“Las Divinas” (The Divine Ones) is a group made up of 11 people from a sugarcane producing zone.  Its residents work cutting sugarcane, planting it and work in a large sugarcane plantation that processes sugar located in the community.

Omar is one of the group members.   He’s 33 years old and only went to elementary school.  He’s single living with his family in the community of Vicente.  He relates that he’s always worked to get ahead but for the last year he’s been operating a taco shop and small eatery at home in a small porch area he has in front.  His sales take place on the weekends (Friday, Saturday and Sunday).  Since he’s been selling now for some time he has regular customers who come by to purchase from him.

Omar will invest this loan in the purchase of meat, tortillas, cabbage, radishes, an assortment of chilies, onions, tomatoes, oil, gas and soft-drinks to prepare his food to sell.  He hopes that with this loan his business as well as his profits will continue to grow because he plans to invest his profits in the purchase of tables and chairs.

The other group members are:

Ilse – shoe sales
Griselda – food sales
Diana – meat sales
Zoila – pastry sales
Irma – cosmetics sales 
Marcelina – Mexican fast food snack sales
Teófila – meat sales 
Jesica - pharmacy 
Minerva – meat sales
Miguel – grocery sales

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 36 and has been in farming for ten successive years, producing and selling maize, beans, and milk at the local market near her rural home in the western Kenya region. She currently runs her farm with the help of one farmhand.

Jackline has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says this will boost her farming income and help her venture into poultry farming in the near future. She plans to have a flock of 2,000 birds once she starts poultry farming.

Jackline faces challenges like poor infrastructure and unreliable weather conditions.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Valens

texts.en:
Valens is married with six children aged between two and 16, all of whom are enrolled in school.  Valens has been a rice farmer for 15 years, and his wife also works as a farmer. He would like this Kiva loan so he can buy seeds and pay for labor costs to get a better harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the farming area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for rice production labor.

loans.name: Pierre

texts.en:
Pierre is married.  He has two children, and they are still too young to start school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 20 years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy seeds and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for seeds and support labor costs

loans.name: Etienne

texts.en:
Etienne is married with three children between the ages of 10 and 18, all of whom are enrolled in school. Etienne has been a rice farmer for 20 years, and his wife also works as a farmer. He would like this Kiva loan to buy seeds and pay for labor costs to get a better harvest. With his profits, he plans to expand the farming area he has been using to increase his output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and rice production labor.

loans.name: Cisne Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Cisne esta integrado por 10 personas cada una de ellas desarrolla una actividad economica Alexandra venta de antojitos, Juaquina venta de antojitos, Andrea venta de zapatos, Elizabeth zapatos, Raul servicio de taxi, Guadalupe venta de antojitos, Salvador lavado de autos, Lidia Calzado, Fedora venta de comida, Laura venta cosmeticos. Este grupo esta ubicado en la comunidad de vicente en la cual esta el ingenio productor de azucar la margarita, y su gente se dedica a la siembra y cultivo de caña. 

Salvador tiene la edad de 34 años años, estudio la secundaria y es soltero actualmente vive con sus padres y platica que cuando el era pequeño su papa tenia una vulcanizadora y un lavado de autos en el cual desde muy pequeño aprendio a trabajar y ahora que es grande ha heredado el negocio familiar. El se encuentra muy contento de continuar con este negocio y mas porque trabaja a lado de sus hermano, su auto lavado se encuentra ubicado en la orilla de la carretera enfrente de su hogar, su negocio es uno de los mas conocidos en su pueblo por el buen servio que dan a los autos, muchos de sus clientes comentan que en su negocio la atención al cliente y a su automóvil es muy buena por eso siempre vuelven a lavar su carro con salvador. 

Salvador invertia su credito en la compra de compresora, magueras, Jabon, escobas, franelas para continuar con su negocio. 

el espera que su negocio continue progresando ya que gracias a el su familia a salido a delante y desea dar a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida.

este grupo agradece el apoyo que se ha brindado.
texts.en:
The “Cisne” (Swan) group is made up of 10 people each with their own economic activity.  Alexandra sells fast food snacks, Juaquina sells fast food snacks, Andrea sells shoes, Elizabeth sells shoes, Raul provides taxi service, Guadalupe sells fast food snacks, Salvador has a car wash, Lidia sells shoes, Fedora sells food, Laura sells cosmetics.  This group is from the community of Vicente where the “La Margarita” sugar processing estate is located.  Residents work growing and harvesting sugarcane.

Salvador is 34 years old.  He went to secondary school and is single living with his parents.  He relates that when he was little his father had a tire repair shop and car wash where he learned how to work when he was still very little.  Now that he’s grown he’s inherited the family business.  He’s very happy to continue with this business and more so because he works alongside his brother.  The car wash is located alongside the highway that runs in front of his house.  The business is one of the better known ones in his town because of the good service they give the cars.  Many of his customers comment that in his business service to customers and attention paid to the cars is very good so they always come back to Salvador to wash their cars.

Salvador will invest his loan in the purchase of an air compressor, hoses, soap, brooms and flannel rags to continue with his business.  He hopes it will continue making progress because thanks to it his family has moved ahead and he wants to give his parents a better quality of life.

This group appreciates the support it’s gotten.

loans.use: to buy car washing equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Shariffa

texts.en:
Shariffa is 40 years old. She is married to a farmer and blessed with three children. Shariffa is a courageous and spiritual woman. She previously was involved in a saloon business and decided four years ago to involve herself in a retail business where she sells spare parts. She also sells cakes and sodas and runs an M-Pesa (mobile-phone-based money transfer) service to increase her income. Her business is located in a busy and viable area. She has one employee, who helps her in the retail business. 

Shariffa faces a challenge of insufficient funds to expand the business. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy additional stock of spare parts. She plans to run a wholesale spare parts business and with the profits educate her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of spare parts.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 51 years old.  He is married and has two children, who are 6 and 12 years old. He loves what he does for his retail business.  He sells various household items, such as sugar, flour, salt, steel wire, snacks, etc. In addition, Leonard is a farmer, which helps him to increase his profits from his two businesses.  He has been in the retail business for ten years.  He is in a viable area for business, which is fast-growing and expanding. 

Leonard is facing a challenge of insufficient funds for improving his business; therefore, he is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to buy more bundles of flour for his business to increase his stock and meet the demands of his customers.  Leonard has a dream of running a wholesale shop that is well-known for its quality items. He is a vigilant and business-oriented man.

loans.use: To buy bundles of flour to improve his retail business

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has been operating a green grocery as well as selling fish in the market. Seasonality is one major challenge she faces. She dreams of starting a kiosk.

With the 10,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase vegetables and tomatoes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and tomatoes for her green grocery.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 34-year-old lady from Kisumu City. She and her husband Joseph, an artisan, have four children between the ages of four and 14.

For the last 11 years, Jackline has been operating a food stall, where she sells snacks known locally as "Mandazi." She earns a monthly income of 6,000 KES. She is taking out her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy baking flour and cooking oil. 

She will use her profits to pay school fees and expand her business. Her dream is to continue to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy baking flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anìbal

texts.es:
Aníbal   es un hombre  que tiene  33 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con tres hijos a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Aníbal  vive  en el  caserío Insculass del distrito de Olmos, departamento de Lambayeque; así mismo cuenta con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica; también se menciona que en este distrito viven todas las  familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Aníbal es al transporte público de mototaxi el recorrido lo realiza entre las zonas de Insculas  – Olmos  y visciversa. Además se dedica a la crianza y engorde de ganado caprino,  generándole otros ingresos para cubrir gastos propios; cabe destacar que en esta actividad  de transporte público Aníbal cuenta con 4 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. 
Actualmente  Aníbal esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/. 2000 nuevos soles que será para el mantenimiento de su vehiculo (cambio de neumáticos, sistema de arrastre y cambio de aceite),  y compra de alimentos para sus animales esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Aníbal, 33, has a spouse and three children in his care.  He lives with his spouse and children in his own house.  It’s mentioned that the quality of life in the community is at the subsistence level.  Most of the residents are independent workers who are in commerce, agriculture and animal husbandry. 

Aníbal lives in the Insculas settlement in Olmos District, Lambayeque Department.  He has electricity and it’s mentioned also that all the families in this district live under these conditions.

Aníbal’s commercial activity is public mototaxi transportation on the Insculas-Olmos route and vice versa.  He also raises goats generating additional income to cover his own expenses.  It’s worth mentioning that Aníbal has four years’ experience providing public transportation which has allowed him to retain his regular business clientele.

At present, Aníbal is asking for a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 new soles to service his vehicle (replace tires, gears and chains and oil change) and to buy animal feed because this is a very profitable activity in the zone which in time will allow him to improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy tires, gears and chains, change the oil and to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more tomatoes

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia  es una mujer que tiene  58 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con 1 hijo a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Julia  vive  en el  caserío Las Pampas del distrito de Olmos, departamento de Lambayeque; así mismo cuenta con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica; también se menciona que en este distrito viven todas las  familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Julia es al comercio de limón y maracuyà a la ciudad de Lima, lo realiza dos a tres veces a la semana, su hijo en Lima le recibe la carga y lo comercializa. Además se dedica a la crianza y engorde de ganado caprino,  generándole otros ingresos para cubrir gastos propios; cabe destacar que en esta actividad  de comercialización Julia cuenta con 10 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. 
Actualmente  Julia esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/. 2500 nuevos soles que será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de limón, maracuyà y animales)  y compra de alimentos para sus animales esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Julia, 58, has a spouse and one son in her care.  She lives with her spouse and child in her own house.  It’s mentioned that the quality of life in the community is at the subsistence level.  Most of the residents are independent workers who are in commerce, agriculture and animal husbandry. 

Julia lives in the Las Pampas settlement in Olmos District, Lambayeque Department.  She has electricity and it’s also mentioned that all the families in this district live under the same conditions.

Julia’s commercial activity is selling lemons and passion fruit in the city of Lima.  She does so three times a week.  Her son in Lima receives the shipment and sells it.  She also raises goats to sell which generates extra income to cover her own expenses.  It’s worth noting that Julia has 10 years’ experience in this line of commerce which has allowed her to retain her business’ established regular clientele.

At present, Julia is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a new loan in the amount of 2500 new soles which will be used as working capital to buy lemons, passion fruit and animals and to buy animal feed because this is a very profitable activity in the zone which in time will allow her to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy lemons, passion fruit and animal feed.

loans.name: Dan Aaron Gammal Yeshua

texts.es: Dan  es  una persona   trabajadora  y  muy  responsable, hace   poco tiempo   abrió una estética  la  cual atiende  su esposa  y  juntos  contribuyen con los  gastos familiares,  el  se  acerco a la institución ya  que  desea  realizar  la compra  de materia  prima para  seguir  laborando,  ve  en el crédito  la posibilidad   de  hacer  crecer  su  negocio  generando  mayores  ingresos  por  lo que  agradece   el  apoyo  brindado.
texts.en: Dan is a very hardworking, responsible person.  A short time ago he opened a beauty salon his wife operates and together they contribute to household expenses.  He approached the institution because he wants to buy raw materials to continue working.   He sees in the loan the possibility of making his business grow generating higher income so he is grateful for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his beauty salon.

loans.name: Amuza

texts.en:
Amuza is married with three children aged between three months and five years. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 15 years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy seeds and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seeds and support labor costs for rice production

loans.name: Torre Fuerte I Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TORRE FUERTE I” iniciará su segundo ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Villa Tejada, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva, donde la señora María es la secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de productos de belleza, venta de tienda de barrio, venta de calzados, venta de muebles.

La señora María, indica que  es el segundo ciclo que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de muebles que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de sus tíos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar de mercadería de su negocio (compra de muebles), mismo que comprará de las distribuidoras de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyarse ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta lasa capacitaciones en salud y crédito

En la fotografía podemos observar la ausencia de la señora Daniela, la misma fue a consulta médica.
texts.en:
The “Torre Fuerte I” (Mighty Tower I) communal bank will start its second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Tejada Focal Center.  It has six members led by a governing board whose secretary is María.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them we have: beauty products sales, neighborhood grocery store, shoe sales and furniture sales.

María indicates that this is the second cycle she’s participated in a Pro Mujer communal bank having been invited to join by a girlfriend.  She currently has a furniture selling business that she’s been operating for years having learned it from her uncles.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase merchandise in her business (to purchase furniture) that she’ll buy from distributors in the city of El Alto and then sell in her sales point.  This business helps her to support herself since she’s married and has a son.

When asked what she likes best about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health training and the credit.
  
In the photo, Daniela’s absence is noted; she was at a health clinic appointment.

loans.use: to buy furniture.

loans.name: Paraiso Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PARAISO” iniciará el ciclo primer en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Yesenia es la tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: artesanía de calzados, venta de artículos varios, brostería, salón de belleza, venta de calzados, venta de ropa.

La señora Yesenia, indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de unas amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de calzados de cholita y damas, mismo que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su padre.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cuero), que comprará de las ferias paceñas y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención en salud y la comprensión.
texts.en:
The “Paraíso” (Paradise) communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board with Yesenia as its treasurer.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them we have: shoe making, general merchandise sales, Broasted chicken sales, beauty salon, shoe sales and clothes sales.

Yesenia indicates that she’s been part of Pro Mujer for three years having been invited to join by some girlfriends.  She currently has a “cholita” [traditional indigenous] and women’s shoe manufacturing business that she’s been operating for years.  She learned it from her father.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase working capital (purchase of leather) that she’ll buy in street markets in La Paz and after manufacturing will sell in her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to help her family in whatever way possible since she’s single and has a son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health services and the understanding.

loans.use: to buy leather.

loans.name: Fabiola Isabel

texts.es: Fabiola  es una  persona  muy  trabajadora la  cual  día  con  día  se  esfuerza  por    brindarle   lo   mejor  a  sus  hijos,  uno  de  sus  principales  sueños   es acondicionar   su  casa ya  que  esta  representa  su  patrimonio  familiar,  en  esta  ocasión  ella  requiere  realizar   la compra  de  un portón para  su  hogar,  ve  en  el crédito  la posibilidad  de  que  su  vivienda  se  encuentra mas  protegida  de la inseguridad   por  lo  que  se  encuentra  muy  contenta.
texts.en: Fabiola is a very hardworking person who strives day to day to offer the best to her friends. One of her main dreams is to remodel her house since this is her family's asset. At this time, she needs to buy a gate for her house. In the loan she sees a possibility of being more protected from crime and because of that she is very happy.

loans.use: to buy a gate.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is married with three children. His wife works as a rice farmer. He has spent six years as a rice farmer. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy seeds and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for seeds and support labor costs

loans.name: Las Lupitas Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Las Lupitas esta integrado por 5 mujeres emprendedoras, alegres y muy trabajadoras Magdalena es una de las mujeres que conforma este grupo ella tiene la edad 20 años estudio  la preparatoria y es madre soltera de una pequeña niña, ella nos platica que desde que se convirtió en madre soltera a tenido que trabajar para sacar a delante a su pequeña hija. Magdalena se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace un poco mas 3 años ella inicio mostrando sus catálogos y vendiendo sus productos a sus vecinas y con el pasar del tiempo a ganado muchas cliente en toda su comunidad, ella dice que le gusta mucho su negocio porque aunque camina mucho conoce mucha gente y las ganancias que obtiene le han ayudado a sacar a delante a su hija. Ella platica que lo que mas le ha gustado de su actividad es que lo puede hacer en su tiempo libre por las tarde.
Magdalena invertira este credito en la compra de variedad de cremas, esmaltes, labiales, sombras, delineadores y catalogos para continuar realizando sus ventas. 
 Magdalena desea que su negocio continue creciendo y cada vez tener mas clientas para que sus ingresos aumenten y asi poder dar una mejor calidad de vida a su hija, tambien desea que su hija en un futuro pueda estudiar una profesion y sabe que solo lo lograra trabajando duro.

Las demas integrantes del grupo son:
Virginia cria y venta de ganado
Maria Elena venta de ropa 
Victoria venta de comida 
Lourdes venta de perfumes
texts.en:
The group "Las Lupitas" consists of five enterprising, cheerful, and hardworking women. Magdalena is one of the women in this group. She is 20 years old and studied through high school. Magdalena is a single mother with a young daughter. Since becoming a single mother, Magdalena says that she has had to work hard to help her daughter get ahead. She has been selling cosmetics for a little more than three years. She started out by displaying her catalogs and selling her products to neighbors. As time went by, she gained many customers from all over her community. Magdalena says that she greatly enjoys her business because the walking that is required has allowed her to meet many people. The revenue she generates has helped her daughter to move forward. The best part of her job is that she is able to have her afternoons free.

Magdalena will invest her loan in the purchase of various crèmes, nail polishes, lipsticks, eye shadows, and eye liners, as well as catalogs so that she can continue making sales. She wants her business to continue growing. Every time she gains more customers, her income increases and she is able to provide her daughter a better quality of life. Magdalena also wants her daughter to study for a profession and to know that the only way to accomplish this is through hard work.

The other members of the group are as follows: • Virginia raises and sells cattle. • Maria Elena sells clothing. • Victoria sells food. • Lourdes sells perfumes.

loans.use: to buy crèmes, nail polishes, lipsticks, eye shadows, and eye liners.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 26-year-old lady from Kisumu City and is married to Moses.  They have two children, who are five and eight years old.

Beatrice sells timber.  It is a business she has been in for the last three years.  She makes a monthly income of KES 10,000.  She is applying for her first loan, which she will use to buy more timber stock to sell. 

Her profits will be used to pay for school fees. Her dream is to open another business.

loans.use: To buy more timber stock

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. Her husband, who is a fisherman, also contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She lives in her own house with no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Amina has been selling fresh fish for the past two years; she sells at the market. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She aspires to own a well-stocked cereal shop.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase fishing hooks to expand her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets for her fishing business

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es: María Antonia  madre de familia viuda cuenta con 77 años de edad vive en casa propia con un hijo, se dedica a las labores del hogar y en su tiempo libre atiende su parcela en ayuda de su hijo, ya que desde muy pequeña fue enseñada por su padre a sembrar, cosechar y todo lo relacionado con el cultivo y cuidados del café. todas las parcelas que ella posee fueron compradas por su finado esposo, María Antonia quiere aumentar su plantación por hectárea ya que actualmente cuenta con 4000 plantas y quisiera en el futuro poder tener al menos unas 5600 plantas productivas en la actualidad es productora de café convencional y le gustaría producir café orgánico para lo cual esta de acuerdo en seguir instrucciones y asistencia de los técnicos de la Unión Regional para logar dicho objetivo y realizar nuevos trazos para utilizar mejor su superficie de terreno y con ello aumentar su producción para lograr tal propósito  pide un crédito para la compra de plantas, fertilizantes y para el pago  de los jornaleros que le ayudaran a trazar su finca para sembrar las plantas nuevas y así poder aumentar su producción y aunado a esto tener ganancias económicas que en un futuro le ayudaran a cumplir su sueño que es tener una casa mas grande para cuando la visiten sus hijos tengan donde quedarse.
texts.en: María Antonia is a 77 year old mother. She lives in the home she owns with one son. She does the housework and in her free time attends to her parcel of land with her son's help. Since she was very young she was taught by her father how to plant, harvest and do everything related to growing and caring for coffee. All of the parcels she has were bought by her deceased husband. María Antonia wants to increase her plantings per hectare since right now she has 4000 plants and in the future would like to have at least 5,600 productive plants. Right now she is a conventional coffee grower and she would like to produce organic coffee. She is willing to follow instructions and receive help from the technicians from the Unión Regional to achieve this goal. To achieve this goal and do new plantings to better use her area of land, thus increasing her production. To do this she is asking for a loan to buy plants, fertilizer and to pay the laborers who will help her prepare her farm to put in new plants and thus increase her production and with this have earnings that will help her in the future to maker her dream come true and have a bigger house so her children have a place to stay when they visit.

loans.use: to pay laborers to help her do some new plantings so she can increase her production per hectare. She will also buy fertilizer and plants.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a 43-year-old widow from Kisumu City.  She has three children who are 17, 12 and seven years of age.

She operates a grocery store.  She has been running this a business for the last 14 years and earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES.  She is taking her second loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy onions, tomatoes and carrots.  She will use the profits to educate her children.

Her dreams include having a big business, buying land and building a family house.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes and carrots.

loans.name: Amiran

texts.en:
Amiran is 44 years old. He lives in the Khelvachauri District with his family: his wife, Manana, a 15-year-old daughter, a 13-year-old son, and his mother, who has a pension. His children go to school. Amiran earns his living through agriculture. He runs a family-owned small dairy farm with two milk cows. Amiran produces, on average, 8 kg of cheese per week and takes it once each week to Batumi Market to sell.  Along with the above mentioned, the family grows fruits and vegetables on a family-owned plot of land. Amiran sells harvested fruits and vegetables at the same market. The total average monthly income of his family is 500 Laris, including the pension of Amiran’s mother.

Amiran requested a loan for purchasing materials for greenhouse construction. He will grow various vegetables in the greenhouse during the whole year and sell them in Batumi. The income of his family will increase, and his harvest won't be affected by the season, as the greenhouse will be busy the whole year.

loans.use: To purchase wooden materials and polyethylene for greenhouse construction

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is single.  He has been a rice farmer for four years.  He is requesting this loan to buy seeds and to pay labor costs to support his efforts and obtain the best possible harvest.  With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been farming to produce more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009).  Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations.  For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions.  Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and to pay labor costs to support rice production.

loans.name: Mujeres Con Visión  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres con Visión está formado por 17 socias quienes viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia del país, ciudad de clima frió pero su gente es de un corazón muy cálido. Nuestras socias son mujeres carismáticas, mantienen su buen sentido del humor y gracias al trabajo arduo que realizan pueden solventar los gastos de su hogar y sacar adelante a sus familias, ellas mantienen un la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María angelita,  vive por el sector de Quinta Chica en la ciudad de Cuenca,  tiene 28 años, es madre soltera de un hijo de 9 años de edad que estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres y comparte los gastos del hogar, su padre se dedica a la construcción y su madre se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar.

La Señora. María Angelita se dedica al comercio, ella compra y vende artesanías elaboradas en yeso, esta actividad la realiza hace 4 años y su mercadería la vende recorriendo la ciudad, labora de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo. 

Este es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de artesanías para tener una mayor variedad. 

Su meta es llegar a tener su propio taller para fabricar sus artesanías.

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Mujeres con Visión" (Women with Vision) consists of 17 members who live in different parts of the city of Cuenca. This city was named a World Heritage Site in December 1999. Cuenca is the third largest city in Ecuador and is known for its cold climate, but its people have very warm hearts. The members of this group are charismatic women who maintain a good sense of humor. Thanks to their hard work, they are able to cover their household expenses and help their families move forward. They have also maintained the cultures and traditions of their people.

One of the members of this group is Sra. María Angelita. She lives in the District of Quinta Chica in the city of Cuenca. She is 28 years old and a single mother of a nine-year-old son who attends a school in the city. María Angelita does not own a home, so she lives at her parents' house and shares in the household expenses. Her father is in construction while her mother is in charge of the household chores.

Sra. María Angelita is in the retail trade. She buys and sells handicrafts made of plaster. She has been in this business for four years and her merchandise is sold while she travels around the city. María Angelita works Monday through Friday, but she does not have a set schedule. This is her first loan with the Communal Bank. She will invest in the purchase of handicrafts so that she will have greater variety. Her goal is to have her own workshop for producing handicrafts.

The smaller photo shown is of a member who was not present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Benito  es un hombre que tiene 42  años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con dos  hijos,  vive  en casa propia con su cónyuge y sus hijos. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Benito vive en  el caserío Somate Alto del distrito de Tambogrande del  departamento de  Piura, así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica, el consumo de agua lo realizan a través de un pozo artezanal; Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Benito es la crianza/venta de ganado porcino , ovinos  y aves de corral , la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Benito cuenta con 5 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; él  vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo  también se dedica a su chacra donde tiene instalado  1.0  has de cultivo de limón lo cual presenta buen estado fenològico y donde  le permite tener otro ingresos. 
Actualmente  Benito se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/.1800 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de alimentos balanceado y fertilizantes para su cultivo de limón; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Benito is a 42-year-old man. He's in a common law marriage and has two children. He lives with his wife and children in a house he owns. Living conditions in the community are at subsistence levels and most of the people who live there are independent workers. They work in retail, raise small animals and in addition some of them also work in farming. Benito lives in the settlement of Somate Alto, district of Tambogrande, department of Piura. They only get basic electricity services, and water consumption is made through an artesian well. All the families who live there are under these conditions.
Benito's business is raising and selling pigs, sheep and corral poultry. He raises these animals in corrals outside of his home. Benito has 5 years of experience in this business, which has allowed him to maintain his already well-established clientele. He sells his animals to local wholesalers. He also works on his farm, where he has a 1.0-hectare lemon crop, which is in a good phenological state and provides him with more profits.
Benito currently intends to stock up his animal raising and sales business, because it's a very profitable activity in the area. For those reasons he requests a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1.800 nuevos soles. He will use the loan to purchase animal feed and fertilizer for his lemon crop. In time, this will allow him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase feed for fattening animals and fertilizer for his crop.

loans.name: Margarito Valerio

texts.es: Desde hace 40 años Margarito se ha dedicado a producir café. Sus abuelos y sus padres le enseñaron a él y a sus hermanos todo lo relacionado con el cultivo del mismo, pues es la principal actividad económica de la región en donde vive. Actualmente Margarito y su esposa Juana tienen una producción anual de 10 toneladas y junto con sus hijos trabajan en sus fincas de café. La meta de Margarito es que dentro de 3 años sus fincas produzcan un total de 18 toneladas anuales, pues aunque cuenta con terreno suficiente para lograr esta producción es necesario que siembre más planta, ya que mucha de la que tiene es vieja y no tiene un buen rendimiento y por esta razón él necesita de un crédito. Margarito entrega todo su café en un centro de acopio de la localidad en que vive para que posteriormente sea enviado a la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” que se encarga de exportarlo. A Margarito le gustaría dar a sus hijos un mejor nivel de vida, sobre todo porque 2 de sus hijos tienen capacidades diferentes y en la comunidad en la que viven no cuenta con las instalaciones para poder atenderlos. También en un futuro le gustaría poner una tienda en su casa y sabe que trabajando el café como hasta ahora lo ha hecho será posible lograr todo esto.
texts.en: For 40  years, Margarito has grown coffee. His grandparents and his parents taught him to and his siblings everything about growing it. This is the main economic activity in the area where he lives. Right now Margarito and his wife Juana have an annual production of 10 tons and with his children they work in the coffee fields. Margarito's goal is for his plantings to produce a total of 18 tons within 3 years. Although he has enough land to achieve this production, he needs to put in more plants. Many of the ones he has are old and have low yields. That is why he needs a loan. Margarito delivers all of his coffee to a distributing center in the community where he lives so it can be sent later to the "Huatusco Regional Union" which exports it. Margarito would like to give his children a better quality of life, especially because two of his children have different capacities and the community they live in doesn't have the facilities to serve them. In the future he would also like to open a store in his house and he knows that working with coffee like he has so far has made it possible to achieve all of this.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants to renew his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a stock of beans, groundnuts, maize, and green grams

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
This is Sofia.  She is 44 years old and a resident of Manila, Philippines.  She is married to Edgardo, who is a driver, and a mother to her three children.  Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income to meet her everyday expenses.  

Sofia operates a variety store.  In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages in small quantities to members of the local neighborhood.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5-PHP worth of cooking oil or an egg.  She earns money by acquiring supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece.  Her store is located adjacent to her house.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP. She will use this loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Sofia hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. S he faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 50 years old, married to Jenipher, and blessed with 7 children between the ages of 10 and 23 years. His spouse, Jenipher, runs her own chemist's, thus adding income to the family. Samuel sells motorcycle spare parts and has been in the business for a period of over 12 years, earning a monthly income of 13,000 KES.  

He has requested a loan of 100,000 KES from KADET LTD as his fifth loan. He wishes to use this amount to pay school fees for his daughter who attends Mount Kenya University.  

The profits he obtains from his business will be used to repay the loan. He hopes to educate his children to the higher level of education and also to prosper in his business.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Stellaphine

texts.en:
Stellaphine is forty years old and married to Stephen. They are blessed with four children who attend school.

She owns a quarry in Lukenya. She has been in this business for the last sixteen years and earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES. She is applying for her second loan of 100,000 KES from KADET LTD which she plans to use to buy another quarry site.

She will use the extra profit to expand her business. She hopes to educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: to add an extra quarry.

loans.name: Luis Eusebio

texts.es: Luis jefe de familia, hombre trabajador y honesto. Hoy en dia administra su propio taxi que ha sido el medio y a su vez el sustento principal para llevar el pan de cada dia a sus cuatro hijos y su señora esposa. Con financiamientos anteriores ha podido irle haciendo mejoras a su vivienda ya que para el su objetivo se ha centrado en la construccion total de su casa. Su esposa quien labora para una empresa privada ocupando el cargo de gerente manifiesta sentirse muy contenta en ayudarle a su esposo ya que ultimamente todo esta a alto costo, los precios de la canasta basica se han disparados y pues con la labor que desempeña su esposo al tener turnos irregulares e ingresos altos y bajos no le da para cubrir la totalidad de los gastos del hogar. Agradece a la micro-financiera que ha sido la puerta de financiamiento para el llegar haber logrado lo que una vez habia soñado y ver mejoras notorias a su vivienda. Con este su septimo ciclo credito lo que se propone es mejorar techo y cielo raso de un cuarto logrando con esta nueva inversion cosechar exitos y ofrecerles a su familia mejores comodidades y mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Luis is a hardworking, honest man, head of household.  Driving his own taxi has been his main source of income to bring sustenance and earn daily bread for his four children and his wife.  With previous loans he was able to gradually do some home improvements his main objective being to build his entire house.  

His wife, who works as a manager in a private firm, says that she’s very happy to help her husband because everything lately has become so expensive and prices of basic staple items have shot up and because her husband’s work schedules are irregular his income fluctuates and is insufficient to cover the totality of household costs.  

He thanks the micro-lender that has been the doorway to financing that has allowed his dream of making significant improvements to his house become a reality.  He will use this seventh loan cycle to repair the roof and ceiling in one of the rooms attaining with this investment to reap success and offer his family greater comfort and a better standard of living.

loans.use: to repair the roof of his home

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz tiene 49 años y es una mujer singular. Vive en compañía de Ronald, su esposo, desde hace 18 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Luz, Jorge y Edwin, a los que cuidan en su casa propia ubicada en el anexo de San Pedro de Saño. 

Durante todo este tiempo de trabajo arduo pudo obtener muchas cosas, entre ellas, una botica donde vende medicinas y da el servicio de inyecciones y primeros auxilios. Todo esto, gracias a su hija mayor que la ayuda en la administración del negocio. Pero su principal actividad es la agricultura, pues desde muy pequeña comenzó a producir la tierra; sus principales sembríos constan de papa y alfalfa que le sirven para la comida de sus vacas. Tiene 6 vacas y 2 toros para el arado de la tierra. También prepara queso para su propio consumo personal y bebe la leche que produce su ganado. Aunque todavía tiene a sus hijos estudiando, ella sigue ahorrando pues quiere mejorar su botica, “lo lograré porque recibo el apoyo de mi esposo que trabaja como albañil”, afirma. Asimismo, hace algunos meses comenzó a vender comida durante los fines de semana en un local que alquila en una zona de mucha afluencia en la ciudad, su platillo principal es la “Pachamanca”, que es en base a varias carnes, tubérculos y verduras cocinados bajo tierra. Este es su nuevo proyecto y tiene la seguridad de que saldrá adelante.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “San Pedro” y éste es el crédito número 20 que tiene con MFP, donde espera cumplir con sus objetivos. Por ello promete cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su grupo porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.  

Luz invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de insumos para preparar la rica pachamanca que sólo ella sabe hacer.
texts.en:
Luz is 49 years old and an exceptional woman. She lives with Ronald, her husband of 18 years. They have three children: Luz, Jorge, and Edwin. They are cared for in their own home, which is located in the annex of San Pedro de Saño.

Throughout this entire time, she has worked hard to obtain many things. These include a pharmacy where she sells medicines and provides services, such as injections and first aid. Most importantly, her grown daughter helps with managing this business. Luz engages in farming as her main business activity since she began working on the land at a very young age. Her main crops are potatoes and alfalfa. The latter is used as feed for her cows. Luz owns six cows and two bulls for plowing the land. She also prepares cheese for personal consumption and baby's milk produced by her cows. Although she still has children in school, Luz continues to save toward making improvements to her pharmacy. "I want to do this so that I can help my husband who works as a bricklayer," says Luz.

A few months ago, she began selling food on the weekends from a rented space in an area of the city where many people gather. Her main dish is "pachamanca", which is made with different meats, tubers, and vegetables, and cooked in the ground. With this new venture, she is confident of moving forward.

Luz is a member of the San Pedro Communal Bank. This is her 20th loan with MFP and she hopes to accomplish her goals. Luz promises to complete her payments on time. In addition, she is pleased to be part of her group because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. Luz will invest the money she requested in the purchase of supplies for preparing the rich "pachamanca" that only she knows how to make.

loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing her signature dish.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen  es un hombre que tiene  65 años de edad, de estado civil casado, con 5 hijos que son independientes, vive con su cónyuge  en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Carmen  vive  en el  caserío Indo América del distrito de Cayalti, departamento de Lambayeque; así mismo cuenta con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica  y el consumo de agua lo realizan a través de un pozo artezanal; también se menciona que en este distrito viven todas las  familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Carmen es al comercio de frutas como: limón, manzana, papaya, plátanos, chirimoyas, uvas, maracuyà, lo realiza en su motocargera haciendo el recorrido por los caseríos aledaños, donde le va muy bien en este negocio. Además se dedica a la crianza y engorde de ganado caprino,  generándole otros ingresos para cubrir gastos propios; cabe destacar que en esta actividad  de comercialización Carmen cuenta con 10 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio .Así mismo su cónyuge también le apoya en este negocio. 
Actualmente  Carmen esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/. 4000 nuevos soles que será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de frutas)  y realizar mantenimiento de su vehículo, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 65-year-old man. He's married and has 5 children who are independent. He lives with his spouse in a house he owns. Living conditions in the community are at subsistence levels and most of the people who live there are independent workers. They work in retail, farming and livestock. Carmen lives in the settlement of Indo América, in the district of Cayalti, department of Lambayeque. They get basic electricity services, and water consumption is made through an artesian well. All the families in this district live under these conditions.
Carmen's business is selling fruit such as lemons, apples, papayas, plantains, custard apples, grapes and passion fruit. He does business by driving his 3-wheeler truck on a route through neighboring settlements. He does very well in this business. He also works in raising and fattening goats, which provides him with more profits in order to cover personal expenses. Carmen has 10 years of experience in his sales business, which has allowed him to maintain his already well-established clientele. He also gets support from his wife in this business.
Carmen is currently requesting a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 4.000 nuevos soles. He will use the loan to get working capital (for purchasing fruit) and to do maintenance on his vehicle, since it's a very profitable activity in the area. In time, this will allow him to improve his and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and to do maintenance on his 3-wheeler truck.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda, age 55, is raising hogs as a source of income. She raises hogs to help her husband improve their poor living conditions. 

She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase feed and additional piglets to sustain her business. Her goal is to maximize her hog raising business and to improve her income. Then, she could be able to support the educational needs of her three children.

loans.use: to purchase feed and additional piglets.

loans.name: Aitaly

texts.ru: Айтали –участник группы Терек -4. Айтали 34 года. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, Айтали занимается животноводством.  Айтали имеет в хозяйстве 1 дойную корову, 10 овец, также Айтали предоставляет услуги  грузового авто в сезон уборки урожая и зимой – для транспортировки угля для местного населения. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айтали обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Айтали планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en: Aitaly is a member of the Terek 4 group.  He is 34 years old.  In order to support his family, Aitaly raises livestock. Aitaly has one dairy cow and 10 sheep. Aytali also provides a service transporting cargo by truck during the harvest season, and also coal used by the locals in winters. In order to develop his business further, Aitaly turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners’ for a loan in the amount of 60,000 KGS to buy additional heads of cattle. Aitaly plans to use his revenues to expand his livestock further.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 37-year-old man from Kisumu City. He is married to Emilly, and they have three children, ages two, five and nine years.

Stephen operates a shoemaking and repair business, a business he has had for the last nine years. The business earns him a monthly income of 16,000 KES. He is now taking his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy thread, inner soles and glue for his work. 

His profits will be used to educate his children and improve his living standards. His dream is to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy inner soles, thread and glue.

loans.name: Nonvignon 7 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVIGNON 7 est composé de trois personnes qui s’approvisionnent au même endroit et appartiennent au même groupe de tontine. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe du nom de Assiba Fabrise Rose est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Assiba Fabrise Rose est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à un certain Maurice. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Assiba Fabrise Rose vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Assiba Fabrise Rose a très peu fréquenté l’école, et a appris ensuite la coiffure, activité qu'elle exerce depuis une quinzaine d'année. De façon secondaire, Assiba Fabrise Rose vend des mèches et des produits cosmétiques dans son atelier. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Assiba Fabrise Rose s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Assiba Fabrise Rose sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON 7, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Nonvignon 7 group is composed of three individuals who stock up in the same place and belong to the same community savings fund. This is the third time that the group is seeking financial support from Kiva in order to expand its business activities. The group’s representative, by the name of Assiba Fabrise Rose, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Assiba Fabrise Rose is 36 years old; her husband’s name is Maurice. The spouses have two dependent children, both in school. Assiba Fabrise lives together with her husband and children. The spouses jointly provide for various family needs. Assiba Fabrise Rose had very little formal education. She learned hairdresser’s trade and has been working in this field for some 15 years. As a secondary activity, Assiba Fabrise Rose sells hair extensions and cosmetic products in her shop. This business allow her to be able to meet her family’s needs without major problems. Assiban Fabrise Rose stocks up at a market in Benin. 

With the goal of meeting customer demand and expanding her sales volume and her revenues, Assiba Fabrisa Rose, together with the other members of the Nonvignon 7 group, is seeking her third loan from ALIDé. The two prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan has been in farming for twelve years in her rural home of Kitale, where she lives with her family of seven children aged between fourteen and twenty-one years. She has one farmhand on her farm and sells her produce of maize, milk and beans to the local market. She sells second-hand clothes for additional income.

Joan has made a loan request amounting to 70,000 KES to buy poultry at 40,000 KES and to construct a dairy unit for her cows. She also hopes to increase her flock of birds to 3,000. This is her third loan request after her first and second loans of 30,000 KES and 60,000 KES respectively.

She says that her major challenges remain low quality poultry feed in the market and animal diseases.

loans.use: to buy poultry and construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina  is a petty trader. She sells plastic bowls, baskets, and containers at  Apowa near Takoradi which she has done for 14 years now. She is married, and her husband is a driver. She uses her income to help her husband to pay their utility and accommodation bill. Regina will use her loan to purchase more plastic bowls, baskets, and containers to sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic bowls, baskets, and containers to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice  lives together with her husband and three children at Apowa near Takoradi. Alice sells onions which she has done for five years. She uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their children. Alice will use her loan to purchase sacks  of onions to sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks  of onions to sell.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia  is a petty trader. She sells maize and cassava dough, peas and bananas. She has been in this business for 3 years. Sophia is married to a driver and has 4 children. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees.  Sophia will use her loan to purchase maize and cassava for dough  and various fruits to satisfy her customers.  With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize and cassava for dough and various fruits for resale.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is a fishmonger. She sells smoked fish at Apowa near Takoradi which she has done for 4 years now. Vida is married and has 4 children.  She uses her income to help her husband to feed and clothe their children. Vida will use her loan to purchase more smoked fish to sell. With the new profit she wants to smoke the fish she sells herself.

loans.use: to purchase more smoked fish to sell

loans.name: Younes

texts.en:
Younes is a 37-year-old man; he is married and a father to five sons. All of them are under 18 years old.

Younes is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs, but for the past three years, he has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project, but he needs more support to cover the costs.

Younes is requesting a 1,200 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of repairing and improving the taxi's condition such as: painting the taxi and changing the engine. This will increase the taxi's efficiency  and allow Younes to take more internal and external requests, which will lead to improving the family's income.

Younes is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: To pay for repairing the taxi

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 47-year-old widow from Homabay and has 6 children between the ages of 8 and 27 years.

Joyce operates a clothing selling business, a business she has had for the last 8 years, and makes a monthly income of 8,000 KES. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more stocks of clothes for resale. 

She will use the profits to enlarge her business. Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sumaryadi

texts.en:
Sumaryadi owns a shop that he runs together with his wife. They live in a city about two hours drive from Jakarta. Their kiosk name is Yuli Cell. The kiosk is named after his wife, because most of the time Yuli is the one that runs the business and waits for customers. Yuli Cell is not the only income they generate for the family, because Sumaryadi himself is an employee. Although Yuli is the one who runs the business, the working capital comes from Sumaryadi. And for Loket Ruma, Sumaryadi will be the one that runs the business with a little help from Yuli. Sumaryadi's family has two children,  aged 10 and 4. 

The reason why Sumaryadi decided to become a Loket Ruma agent is because he really wants to expand his business. Currently, most of the items Sumaryadi and his wife sell are airtime from all mobile phone providers in Indonesia and starter packs for mobile phone sim cards. They have also started to sell funny stickers (stickers with jokes, funny icons, proverbs, etc.) and cheap perfumes. 

Being an agent for Loket Ruma means that Sumaryadi will grow his business and become a payment point for bill payment. This loan will serve as a damage deposit for the electronic data capture (EDC) device that as an agent, Sumaryadi will use to enter payments and print receipts for his customers. He is expecting people will use the service to pay monthly installments for things such as cars, motorcycles, and housing. Also, he believes people will come to his kiosk to pay their water and electricity bills, both for prepaid and postpaid electricity bills. 

Basically, he sees this new business program from Ruma as an opportunity that he can take to generate more income. He wants Yuli Cell to be profitable and to be a success in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for a deposit on an electronic data capture (EDC) terminal for a bill payment business

loans.name: Mageret

texts.en:
Mageret cooks and sells kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves). She serves it with fried fish, pepper and tomato sauce in  Mpoho, near Takoradi. She has been in this business for three years. 

Mageret is married and has three children. She uses her income to support her husband in feeding the family and paying their accommodation bills. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish, which she uses in preparing her kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to mount a stall from which to sell her kenkey and fish.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish, which she uses in preparing her kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
This is Ligaya, 39, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Ernesto, a maintenance man, and mother of five children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ligaya operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from round, palm-sized ones to the much larger doormats, and other crafts that most rug-makers come up with every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Ligaya hopes to increase production and dreams of being able to give her family a good life through all her hard work on her business.
