She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie lives in Airport community. She is 40 years old and married with four children between 5 and 27 years old. Her husband is a contractor. For the past 6 years she has been selling rice, palm oil, peppers, Vita, and other items in her community. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She enjoys this business because it help to support her children but one problem she faces is transportation costs for goods delivery. She is asking for a loan to buy more rice, palm oil, peppers, Vita and other items for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy more rice, palm oil, peppers, Vita and other items for her business

loans.name: San Jose  Juan Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama  San Jose  Juan esta integrado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras e indígenas.
Las integrantes de este grupo son originarias de un  pequeño llamado  San Juan  Cacahuatepc mejor conocido como cacahuate.
Una de las tradiciones de la comunidad es la danza de las mascaritas  que se baila en la fecha donde  se celebra el carnaval.
Una de integrantes  de este grupo es la señora  Luz Maria de  treinta años de edad, se caracteriza por ser una señora alegre, amable y respetuosa.
Doña Luz como mejor la conocen sus compañeras de grupo tiene  treinta años, se dedica a la venta de  pescado  desde hace cuatro años.
Los pescados que vende son mojara, robalo, pargo, tichinda  y por pedidos vende los filetes y los camarones.
 Esta felizmente casada con el señor Jesús un señor trabajador y amable que se dedica a siembra  de maíz y trabaja de albañil.
Tiene un hijo que se llama  Jose Antonio, dice que su hijo es el motivo  para que trabaje todos los días y pueda esforzarse más.
Lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es salir a vender a las localidades vecinas sus pescados y platicar con sus las personas.
Pudio el crédito para la compra de mas pescados  y mariscos para la venta por mayoreo y menudeo.
Esta muy agradecida con fundacion por tenderle la mano cuando más lo necesita.
Las otras integrantes  son:
Laura: venta de calzado.
Efigenia: venta de pollos.
Ignacia: venta  de comida.

Le dan las gracias a fundacion por ayudarlas  ha  que su vida tenga sentido y puedan ayudar  a sus familias.
texts.en:
This group is called "San Jose Juan" and consists of four hardworking indigenous women. They are originally from a small town called San Juan Cacahuatepec, which is better known as Cacahuate. One of the traditions of this community is "La Danza de Las Mascaritas" (The Dance of the Little Masks), which is performed on the date of the Carnival celebration.

One of the members of this group is Sra. Luz Maria. She is 30 years old and known as a cheerful, friendly, and respectful woman. Doña Luz is best known among her fellow group members for selling seafood, which she has done for four years. The seafood she sells includes tilapia, sea bass, snapper, and mussels. She also sells fillets and shrimp upon request. Luz is happily married to Sr. Jesús, a hardworking and friendly gentleman who grows corn and works as a bricklayer. They have a son named Jose Antonio, who she says is her motivation to work every day and get stronger. What she enjoys most about her business is being able to sell fish in neighboring towns and talking with the residents. This loan will enable her to buy more fish and shellfish so that she can sell in bulk and in smaller amounts. She is grateful to Fundación Realidad for giving her a hand when she needs it the most.

The other members are as follows: • Laura sells shoes. • Efigenia sells chickens. • Ignacia sells food. They are also grateful to Fundación Realidad for assisting them as they seek to live meaningful lives in an effort to help their families.

loans.use: to buy seafood to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a food vender. She cooks  "banku" (fermented maize dough) for sale. She serves it with "okro" and fish  stew as she has done for 3 years. She lives togerther with her husband  and 3 children  at Apowa near Takoradi.   She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children’s school fees.  Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her "banku" for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded  business   to create a place for her customers to eat.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her "banku" for sale

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en: Lubna is 19 years old and comes from Ramallah. In 2011, Lubna opened an accessories shop in her village, the largest in the Ramallah municipality. Lubna needs to fill her shop with merchandise and add new types of products like shoes. She is studying at college and aspires to be a successful manager in her business. Her goals for the business are to become well-known and eventually open another branch in the city. She is trying her best to be independent financially, and she hopes to increase her income to be able to achieve her goals and support her family.

loans.use: to fill her shop with merchandise

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther sells  maize and cassava dough.  She is married and has 3 children. She lives together with the family at Apowa near Takoradi. Esther has been selling maize and cassava dough for 4 years now. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Esther will use her loan to purchase maize and cassava for the dough she sells. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize and cassava for the dough she sells.

loans.name: Hector Arturo

texts.es: El señor   Héctor  es una persona  trabajadora  la  cual  se  acerco  a la institución ya  que  requiere  de nuestro apoyo  para  realizar   mejoras  a su  vivienda    como  pintar  las  paredes  exteriores   , ve  en el crédito la posibilidad  de ofrecer a  su   familia  una mayor    comodidad,  agradece el apoyo  brindado  para  hacer  de  su sueño  una  realidad.
texts.en: Hector is a hard-working person who approached the institution since he needs our help to improve his home.  He wants to paint the outside walls and he sees that the loan will give him the possibility of offering his family more comfort.  Thanks to this support his dream will become reality.

loans.use: to paint his outside walls

loans.name: Glory Jane

texts.en:
This is Glory Jane, 38, who is a resident of Manila City, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother of one child. She, together with her child, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Glory Jane operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a living by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing this loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Glory Jane hopes to be able to expand soon, as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work from her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members each week to share stories of her work, and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: El Recuerdo (Flat) Group

texts.es:
El grupo  se llama el recuerdo y se integra de cuatro señoras quien cada una se dedica a su respectiva actividad y  viven en un barrio llamado barrio llamado tejería, también conocido como el barrio de los kaitudos.

   Quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama alma yerania  quien tiene vestidos años de edad, vive en unión libre con Mario Alberto y con quien procreo  un hijo quien tiene la edad de tres años.

    Ella se dedica a la venta de trates  por catalogo  de  marca topperware en donde lleva trabajando  un año en donde comenta que le va bien ya que con  ello   ha estado  apoyando  a su esposo  con los  ingresos de la casa  ya  que también una vecina le sute la mercancía y así salir a vender  su trastes.

     En esta actividad se inspiro  a trabajar ya que es un negocio  favorable que deja ingresos y  que  así podrá aportar en su hogar para  que juntos  su esposo logren darle lo más necesario  a su pequeño hijo.

     Lo que más desea es que con el tiempo ella pueda tener un logar estable en donde venda sus trastes a  sus clientes.

    Las personas que integran en el grupo el recuero  son:
    Marlene  quien invertir en la compra de cosmético de la marca Avon, la señora María Leticia  invertirá en la compra de cosméticos de la marca Avon y la señora María del Rosario en la compra y venta de cosméticos de Avon.
texts.en:
The group called "El Recuerdo" consists of four women who engage in their respective businesses. They live in a neighborhood called "Tejería", which is also known as the neighborhood of "Los Kaitudos".

The person being interviewed is Alma Yerania, who is 22 years old. She is in a common-law relationship with Mario Alberto and they have a three-year-old son. Alma sells Tupperware utensils through catalogs. She has been in this business for one year and says that she is doing well. This business enables her to help her husband with the household expenses. A neighbor suggested that she sell merchandise, so she decided to go and sell utensils. This business inspires her to work because she is able to earn an income and help her husband maintain their home. Together they are able to provide for the most important needs of their young son. What she wants most is to eventually have a stable location where she can sell utensils to her customers.

The other members of the group "El Recuerdo" are as follows: • Marlene will invest in the purchase of Avon cosmetics. • Sra. María Leticia will invest in the purchase of Avon cosmetics. • Sra. María del Rosario will buy and sell Avon cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy plastic utensils.

loans.name: Yonddowed

texts.en: Yonddowed is 39 years old and lives in Bardnersville.  She is married.  She has four children between the ages of six to nine, who are in school and live at home.  She has been selling dried fish for the past ten years.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more dried fish for her business.  She has more customers and makes a lot of profit.  Her plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish for her business

loans.name: Tenneh

texts.en: Tenneh is 31 years old and lives in Bardnersville. She is married and has 3 children ages 10 to 14. She stopped her education in 6th grade. Since 2000 she has been selling groundnuts (peanuts) and palm oil. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice and palm oil for her business. She started this business with a small amount received from her husband. Her plan is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and palm oil for her business

loans.name: Tawfiq

texts.en:
Tawfiq is a 44-year-old man. He is married and a father of two sons and one daughter.  For the past four years, he has been selling groceries to customers, which has been a profitable project, but he also needs more support to cover the costs and the family's needs.

Tawfiq is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a variety of groceries. This will satisfy the customers' needs, which will lead to an increase in sales and will improve his family's income.

Tawfiq is pictured in his grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 27 years old and lives in Bardnersville. She is single and has two children, 7 and 12 years old. They are attending school and live at home. Unfortunately for Mamie, she did not go to school. 

For the past two years she has been selling bananas and plantains in the market. She likes the way she makes a lot of profit and the way people respond to her business. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more bananas and plantains for her business. She plans to build a house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas and plantains for her business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is 38 years old and lives in Bardnersville. She is married and has six children ages 2 to 18. They are in school and live at home. She did not go to school. For six years she has been selling chicken, meat, and fish in the market, She is requesting a loan to purchase more chicken, meat, fish, and fresh cassava for her business. She started this business with the help of her husband. Her plan is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken, meat, fish, and fresh cassava for her business

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 34 years old and lives in Bardnersville. She is married and has 4 children ages 11 to 19. They are in school and live at home. She stopped her education in 6th grade. Since 2004 she has been selling fish in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh cassava fish for her business. She started this business with the help of her husband. Her plan is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh cassava fish for her business

loans.name: Mirriam

texts.en:
Mirriam is a married lady aged 32 who has three children aged 13, 10 and five years old.  She buys and sells cereals and has been in operation for a period of three years earning a monthly income of KES. 10,000.  

She has taken out her first loan of KES.10,000 from KADET LTD which she intends to use to purchase 100kg of dry beans for KES. 6,000 and two sacks of dry maize for KES. 4,000.  

The profits earned will be kept as savings for future expansion. She hopes to improve her business and also her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase dry maize and beans for resale

loans.name: Anibal Gerardo

texts.es:
Aníbal  es un hombre que tiene 22  años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con dos  hijos,  vive  en casa propia con su cónyuge y sus hijos. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Aníbal vive en  el caserío Sinchi Roca del distrito de Tambogrande del  departamento de  Piura, así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica, el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de una pileta comunal;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Aníbal es la crianza/venta de ganado porcino , ovinos  y aves de corral (10 ovinos, 10 cerdos y 20 aves de corral) , la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Aníbal cuenta con 2 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; èl vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo su cónyuge también se dedica a su chacra donde tiene instalado  0.5  has de cultivo de limón lo cual presenta buen estado fenològico y donde  le permite tener otro ingresos. 
Actualmente  Aníbal se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/.1500 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de alimentos balanceado y fertilizantes para su cultivo de Limòn, lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Anibal is a 22 year old man who is married and has 2 children.  He lives in his own home with his wife and children.  He says that in his community people live at a subsistence standard of living.  Most of the residents are self-employed and work in retail trade and raising small animals. Also, some of them are farmers.  Anibal lives in the Sinchi Roca settlement in the Tambogrande district, in the department of Piura.  Here the only utility is electricity; he gets his water from a communal tank.  In this place, all of the families live under these conditions.

Anibal has a business raising and selling pigs, sheep and poultry (10 sheep, 10 pigs and 20 chickens).  He raises these animals in corrals that are outside his home.  It should be noted that Anibal has 2 years of experience in this line of work, and this has enabled him to maintain a well-established customer base.  He sells his animals to the wholesale traders in the area.  Also, his wife has a farm where she has half a hectare planted with lemons.  These are growing well and so will generate some extra income.

Now Anibal has proposed to expand his inventory of animals, because this is a very profitable business in this area.  For this reason he is requesting a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa for a sum of 1,500 Peruvian soles, which will allow him to invest in the purchase of balanced animal feed and fertilizers for his lemon crop.  Over time, this will allow him to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 45 years old and lives in Bardnersville. She is single and has three children between 16 and 30 years old. Two live at home and attend school. Mamie did not go to school.  

Since 2000, Annie has been involved in the used clothes business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She will have more customers and make a lot of profit. 

Her plan is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is aged twenty-nine, married, and has three children, all being of school-going ages. She sells second-hand clothes within the local markets to boost a farming business as well.

Mary has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She will use the proceeds to educate her children and meet the family’s basic needs.  

She hopes to grow her dairy farm into five high-quality breeds in five years. Mary says harsh weather conditions and poor road networks are her major challenges.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Amadeo

texts.es: Desde niño Amadeo comenzó a aprender todo lo relacionado con el cultivo del café y a los 30 años su madre le heredó algunas tierras para que el se hiciera cargo de ellas. Actualmente él tiene 60 años y junto con su esposa Martha han logrado sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos a base del empeño que han puesto a la hora de trabajar. Preocupados por obtener café de buena calidad ellos han optado por la producción de manera orgánica al no utilizar fertilizantes que tengan compuestos químicos, lo cual también es bueno para la conservación del medio ambiente. En años anteriores han tenido cosechas de hasta 16 toneladas anuales, pero por diversos motivos no les ha ido muy bien últimamente y en este año sólo lograron producir 5 toneladas. Amadeo necesita un crédito para comprar planta, abono orgánico y realizar actividades de limpieza y con esto en un periodo no mayor a 3 años hará posible que su producción aumente al doble. Una de las cosas que en un futuro le gustaría hacer a Amadeo es mejorar su vivienda pues es de tipo rústico lo que provoca algunas incomodidades para él y su familia.
texts.en: From the time he was a child, Amadeo started learning everything about cultivating coffee.  When he was 30 years old, his mother gave him some land to care for.  Now he is 60 years old, and along with his wife Martha, he has managed to get ahead with his 3 children as a result of the effort that he has put into his work.  Because he has been concerned with producing the best quality coffee, he and his wife have chosen to produce organically, without using chemical fertilizers.  This is also good for the environment.  In previous years they have had harvests of about 16 tons per year, but for a number of reasons things have not gone well lately, and this year they only managed to produce 5 tons.  Amadeo needs a loan to buy plants and organic fertilizers, and to clear the land.   With this, within 3 years, he will be able to double his production.  In the future, one of the things that Amadeo would like to do is to improve his home, because it is built of rustic materials, and this has caused some discomforts for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and coffee plants

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a food vendor. She prepares and sells Ga-kenkey, a dish she serves with fried fish and vegetable sauce. She has been engaged in this business for three years. She and her husband live with their three children at Apowa, near Takoradi. Her husband works as a driver. She uses her income to assist her husband in supporting the family and paying the children’s school fees.  

Mary's loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish, which she uses in preparing her kenkey. 

She intends to use the new profits from her business to create a place for her customers to eat.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing the kenkey that she offers for sale

loans.name: Santos Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina tiene 45 años de edad y desde hace 25 años se dedica a la producción de café. Ella comenzó en este negocio con su esposo, pero desafortunadamente el murió, dejándole a su cargo a sus 3 hijos y las fincas de café. Para Alejandrina salir adelante ha sido muy difícil, pues además de estar al pendiente de sus fincas y hacer las labores de siembra y cosecha, también es ama de casa. Para llevar a cabo todas estas tareas sus hijos la ayudan, pues desde pequeños han combinado los estudios con el trabajo para que de esta manera puedan salir todos adelante como familia. Alejandrina tiene un total de 4,000 plantas de café y su meta es tener 7,000 por lo que ella necesita un crédito para comprar planta y abonar toda su finca. Una vez sembradas estas nuevas plantas en un lapso de 3 años estará cosechándolas y por consiguiente aumentará su producción e ingresos. A ella en un futuro le gustaría comprarse una camioneta para hacer más fácil el transporte de su café y también arreglar su casa para que sus hijos puedan tener mayores comodidades.
texts.en: Alejandrina is 45 years old and has made a living growing coffee for the past 25 years. She started the business with her husband, who unfortunately died, leaving her to care for their three children and the coffee plantation. Making headway has been very difficult for Alejandrina, who along with tending to her land and doing the planting and harvesting is also a housewife. Her children help her carry out all these tasks, and since they were young they have balanced their studies with their work so they all can get ahead as a family. Alejandrina has a total of 4,000 coffee plants and her goal is to have 7,000, which is why she is requesting the loan to purchase plants and fertilizer for all her plantation. Once these plants are in the ground they can be harvested in three years, consequently increasing her production and income. In the future, she would like to purchase a truck to more easily transport the coffee and to also make improvements to her home so her children can have more amenities.

loans.use: to purchase coffee plants and fertilizers.

loans.name: Reymundo

texts.es: Reymundo de 33 años de edad es originario de Estelí, casado, de oficio agricultor se dedica a la  siembra de hortalizas específicamente siembra tomate y chiltoma. Reymundo ha trabajado con créditos otorgados por nuestra institución  y Kiva, anteriormente realizo un  préstamo para compra de insumos tales como fertilizantes, abono, veneno y pago de mano de obra para sembrar media  manzana de chiltoma el cual este préstamo le ayudo a obtener buenas cosechas de su siembra también con las ganancias que saco de la siembra logro acondicionar su vivienda, hoy en día solicita un nuevo préstamo al igual para compra de insumos y pago de mano de obra pero esta vez para sembrar media manzana de tomate, en su negocio recibe el apoyo de su familia, el estima que este nuevo préstamo le ayudara ya que podrá invertir mas en su producción para obtener mejores ingresos y seguir dándole mejora a su humilde casita. Su expectativa una vez finalizado el pago de su préstamo es seguir luchando para sembrar más áreas de cultivos y diversificar sus productos.
texts.en:
Reymundo is 33, a native of Esteli, married and a farmer. He plants vegetables, specifically tomatoes and bell peppers. He has worked with loans given by our institution and Kiva. Previously he used a loan to purchase supplies such as fertilizer, compost, insecticides and to pay laborers to plant half a manzana (1 manzana = approx. 1.73 acres) in bell peppers. The loan helped him to reap good crops from his land. With the earnings he was able to fix up his house. Today he is applying for a new loan to also buy supplies and pay for a labor force, however this time to plant half a manzana in tomatoes.

In his business, Reymundo has his family’s support. He thinks this new loan will help him since he will be able to invest more in production in order to obtain better earnings and continue making improvements to his humble little house. Once he has finished paying off the loan, he expects to continue fighting to plant more vegetables and to diversify his crops.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and to pay laborers to plant .865 of an acre of tomatoes.

loans.name: Sartasiñani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SARTASIÑANI” iniciará su sexto ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva, donde la señora Felipa es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de refrescos y golosinas, costura de deportivos, frutería, venta de calzados, venta de ropa interior, costura, tejedora de chompas, taxista.

La señora Felipa, indica que  es el primer año que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de frutas que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de sus padres.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la siembra de sus productos (compra de abono)  mismo que comprará de las comunidades del altiplano, este le ayudará a fertilizar su tierra. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y el consultorio.
texts.en: The "Sartasiñani" group is starting its sixth loan cycle with Kiva partner Pro Mujer from the Villa Exaltación Center. The group consists of nine members and has a board of directors with Felipa as treasurer. The members have various businesses, among which are: selling snacks and refreshments, sewing jerseys, having a fruit stand, selling footwear, selling undergarments, sewing, weaving sweaters and driving a taxi. Felipa is in her first year as a group member with Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a friend. She currently has a business selling fruits, which she has done for a number of years after learning the trade from her parents. She plans to use the loan to purchase fertilizers for her crops, which she will then sell in the Altiplano communities. This will help her fertilize her land and yield better products. This business has helped her support her family, since she is married and has four children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she enjoys the health classes and consultations.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a prospective student applying for a loan to start her undergraduate work on a Bachelor of Commerce degree at Strathmore University. This is her story:

I am Lydia, the second born in a family of three. I have one parent, my mother, and two siblings. My father died nine years ago. My mother is a housewife and also takes care of a few goats and sheep. None of my siblings got a chance to go to school.

I am from Lodwar in Turkana County. Turkana, in the northern part of Kenya, is a famine-ravaged region and most girls never get to see the inside of a classroom. Most parents prefer to send a boy to school over a girl, because they believe the female will be married off. Some girls are married off by their relatives even at the age of 12 years. I am one of the few lucky girls who went to school.

I completed my primary school education in the year 2007 and proceeded to high school in Turkana. My school fees for high school were paid by my local Catholic parish in Lodwar. I managed to attain a mean grade of B+ in my final high school examination. In my family and village, I am the only one who is educated to secondary school level and this motivates me to put more effort into my studies in order to uplift my family and community at large.

I am happy to apply for this loan to study for a Bachelor of Commerce degree at Strathmore University. Strathmore is my top choice because of its high quality education and facilities. Given this chance by Kiva, my higher education will be easily achieved. Thanks to God for this opportunity.

There are a lot of challenges that I have faced, but normally I encourage myself by saying, "What matters in life is not really where I am now, but rather the direction I am heading." I will never allow my past experiences to compromise the quality of my future. It is my dream to be a role model to many girls in Turkana County.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in Commerce at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is a petty trader (small-scale trader). She sells food items. She also operate a grocery shop at  Apowa near Takoradi.  She has done this for 3  years.  The items in her grocery shop are tin fish, tin tomatoes, Milo (brand of malted milk (Nestle)), different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, powdered milk.  She is married with 3 children. Cecilia uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase food items and a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit,  Cecilia  plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase food items and a variety of groceries to sell

loans.name: Evalin

texts.en:
Evalin is 69 years old, married and has six children. To earn a living, she has a tailoring business. She has been in the business for more than 10 years.  She has employed six people to assist her in her tasks.  

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to manage her business well because she has been trained on business management skills.

Evalin hopes to expand her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen  tiene 34 años de edad  está casada desde hace 14 años con el señor Carlos juntos han procreado cuatros niños los cuales todos asisten a la escuela, Doña Carmen todos comúnmente la conocen en la comunidad tiene una tienda de abarrotes que inicio desde hace dos años para ayudarle a su esposo a solventar los gastos del hogar por el momento no tiene ningún nombre ha solicitado el crédito para comprar productos enlatados, pan leche, huevo, frituras, detergente, “ Más que nada lo que haga falta en la mi tienda” el reto más grande que presenta doña Carmen es la escases de clientes ya que por el lugar donde tiene ubicada su tienda no hay casas para vender un poco mas sin embargo ella mantiene la esperanza de que algún día se llegue a poblar un poco mas y sus ganancias aumenten. También tiene problemas con los preciso tan altos que los dan los proveedores y sus ganancias no son tan satisfactorios como ella quisiera. Con la institución lleva ya tiempo trabajando empezó con un grupo grande pero ahora lleva dos ciclos trabajando sola “A mí el crédito me ha benéfico  ya que gracias a él pude surtir mi tienda y de las ganancias obtenidas mi esposo pudo comprar compresora para autos ya que la meta de Doña Carmen y su Esposo Carlos es llegar a tener un lavado de coches para que Carlos esposo de Carmen pase más tiempo en casa con su familia y ya no tenga que salir tanto para ganarse el pan de cada día. Doña Carmen nos comento “Creo que la Fundación es muy seria y comprometida con sus clientes estoy muy agradecida con la institución y Kiva ya que nuestra calidad de vida podrá mejorar considerablemente si llegamos a tener el negocio de los coches”
texts.en:
María del Carmen is 34 years old and has been married to Sr. Carlos for 14 years. They have four children, all of whom attend school. Doña Carmen, as she is commonly known by everyone in her community, has a grocery store that she started two years ago so that she could help her husband cover the household expenses. At the moment, her store does not have a name. She is requesting a loan to buy canned goods, bread, milk, eggs, fried snacks, and detergents. "More than ever, my store is lacking inventory," she says. Doña Carmen's greatest challenge is the lack of customers because there are few homes where her store is located. However, she is hopeful that some day more people will settle here and that her earnings will increase. Carmen also has problems with the high prices charged by her suppliers, so her profits are not at the level she would like. During the time she has worked with Fundación Realidad, Carmen started out working with a large group, but now she has completed two loan cycles by herself. "The loans have been a great benefit. As a result, I have been able to restock my store. Using the profits that were generated, my husband was able to buy a compressor for automobiles," says Carmen.

Doña Carmen and her husband Carlos have plans to open a car wash. This will allow her to spend more time at home with the family so that she does not have to leave the house in order to earn a living. Doña Carmen comments, "I believe Fundación Realidad is very serious and committed to its clients. I am extremely grateful to FRAC and to Kiva. My family's quality of life has improved considerably and we hope to have a car wash business."

loans.use: to buy milk, bread, eggs, and canned goods.

loans.name: Felipe Efrén

texts.es: Felipe y su esposa Andrea tienen 8 hijos y toda la familia se dedica a la producción de café, pues la situación económica de la región en donde viven es muy difícil y por eso entre todos ayudan a la economía familiar. Durante la última cosecha a Felipe y su familia no les fue muy bien, pues solo tuvieron una producción de 3 toneladas, por lo cual se ven obligados también a trabajar para otras personas, pues el ingreso que obtuvieron del café no es suficiente para mantenerse. El café que ellos producen es tanto orgánico como convencional, sin embargo quieren que toda su producción sea de orgánico pues es mejor pagado en el mercado y para esto necesitan un crédito, pues deben sembrar nueva planta y comprar fertilizante, ya que este proceso lleva de 2 a 3 años. El mayor deseo de Felipe y su esposa es que sus hijos, que actualmente se encuentran estudiando, primaria, secundaria y bachillerato; tengan la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera universitaria para que en el futuro tengan las oportunidades que ellos no tuvieron.
texts.en: Felipe and his wife Andrea have eight children and the whole family is dedicated to growing coffee. The economic situation in their region is very difficult, so they all have to help out the family finances. Things didn't go very well for Felipe and his family during the past harvest, so they only produced three tons, meaning they also had to work for other people because the income they earned from their coffee wasn't enough. The coffee they produce is as much organic as it is conventional, however they want all their production to be organic because it gets a better price at market, and for this they need a loan to plant new crops and buy fertilizers, since this process takes about two to three years. Felipe and his wife's biggest wish is for their children, who currently are studying in elementary and high schools or have graduated, to have the chance to study for a university degree so in the future they have opportunities that their parents didn't have.

loans.use: to purchase coffee plants and fertilizers.

loans.name: Temur

texts.en:
Temur is a 62-year-old farmer from Khelvachauri District, West Georgia. Temur lives in a village with his family: wife, Shushana; three adult daughters (42, 33 and 28 years old); a son-in-law; and three grandsons (3, 2 and 1 year old). 

All adult family members are involved in the family agriculture business. They have a small dairy farm with two milk cows. Shushana produces on average 40 kg of cheese per month and sells it in the Batumi (a nearby town) open market. Also, the family owns 1.5 hectares of land, where citrus and various fruits and vegetables are grown. Temur sells harvested greengrocery products at the same market. Temur’s son-in-law works as a salesperson in a local store and gets a monthly salary. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 Laris.

Temur requested credit for purchasing fertilizers. He will use it for fertilizing the land. Afterward, Temur will sow vegetables and work hard during the spring and summer seasons. He hopes that the weather conditions are favorable and that he gets a good harvest in the summer. The family will get the income they had planned on and use it for financing their daily needs during the year.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is a businesswoman who sells clothes. She has been in the business for four years. She is married and blessed with a 1-year-old child.  

Rahab has learned a lot since she joined Faulu Kenya. This is because she has been trained in business management skills.  She has also become more aggressive in her business.

She hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future. She needs a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.use: To buy shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Aves Del Paraiso Group

texts.es: Doña Cirenia tiene 70 años de edad y es parte del grupo llamado aves del Paraíso, dice que le pusieron ese nombre al grupo por que donde hacen las reuniones hay flores llamadas así. Ella se dedica a comprar madera y hacer cajas para fruta las cuales las vende en otras poblaciones donde venden guayabas, mameyes y papayas que  es lo que se da más en su región. Dice que uno de sus hijos es el que le ayuda hacer las cajas para vender ya que tiene una pequeña carpintería donde hace las cajas. Ella está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de material para elaborar las cajas como madera, clavos, pegamento y para el pago de los fletes. Dice que  aproximadamente cada semana hacen pedidos de 400 a 500 cajas dependiendo cuanto le compren. Dice que gracias al crédito que le harán su negocio mejorara ya que tendrá lo necesario para hacer sus cajas ya que es su principal actividad económica y también así ella puede darles a varias personas trabajo. La meta que tiene doña Cirenia es hacer crecer su negocio y comprar un poco mas de material para así poder hacer mas cajas para frutas. Los otros nueve integrantes se llaman Isela, María Remedios, Socorro, Yaquelin, Marcela, Eva, María Llasmin, Sandra y Florencio ellos invertirán sus créditos en insumos para hacer tortillas, en la compra de artículos para tienda de abarrotes, materiales para construcción que vende, dulces de diferentes sabores para su venta, dulces y frituras para su venta, fruta y verdura de temporada, compra de pollos para criarlos y después venderlos, etc.
texts.en:
Cirenia is 70 years old and is a member of a group called “Aves del Paraíso” (birds of paradise).  She says they named the group this for the flowers that grow where they have their meetings.  

She makes a living buying wood and making boxes for fruit which she sells to other communities where they sell guavas, mameyas (a type of fruit) and papayas, which are the most exploited crops in the region.  One of her children helps her make the boxes to sell, since he has a small carpenter’s workshop where he makes the boxes.  

She is requesting the loan in order to buy the material (wood, cloves and glue) to build the boxes, and also to pay for freight.  She makes about 400 to 500 boxes weekly, depending on how many are purchased.  

She says that thanks to the loan she will be able to improve her business since she will have what she needs to make her boxes, as it is her main source of income and also this way she can provide jobs for a lot of people.  Cirenia’s goal is to increase her business and to buy a little more material so that she can make more boxes for fruit.  

The other nine members are Isela, María Remedios, Socorro, Yaquelin, Marcela, Eva, María Llasmin, Sandra y Florencio.  They invested their loans in ingredients to make tortillas; in the purchase of items for their grocery store; construction materials that they sell; sweets and different savories that they sell; sweets and fritters to sell; seasonal fruit and vegetables; chicken to raise and later sell, etc.

loans.use: to make wooden boxes for fruit.

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en: Philomina is a seamstress. She makes dresses for sale at Apowa, near Takoradi. She has been a seamstress for 5 years now. Philomina uses her income to pay for her accommodations and utility bills. Philomina will use her loan to purchase fabric to make dresses to sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to make dresses for sale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 62 years old, married and has six children. He has been operating a cafeteria to earn a living. He also has rental houses which earn him extra income. He was previously farming before he went into this business. He has managed to improve his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained on business management skills.

John needs 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy sugar, coffee and tea leaves.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee and tea leaves

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente est  Conseillère de groupement de crédit  La Vérité, Femme courageuse, entrepreneur, âgée de 32 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants. Tous ses enfants étudient sauf le cadet. Son mari est un chauffeur auprès d’une organisation privée. Elle est  couturière modéliste de formation et sociétaire d’un atelier de coupe et couture. Elle commença son entreprise avec le fonds propre reçu de son mari, il ya environs 5 ans.  Alors, elle bénéficia le premier  crédit de l’IMF Hekima pour fonds additionnels vers les années 2010. Dit-elle,  cette activité fait grandir ses enfants, c’est à dire  les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et scolarité. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  7eme  cycle de crédit. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’approvisionner des matériels de coupe et couture (tissus, dentelle, fils, bouton, ciseaux, etc.). En plus, elle ambitionne construire confortablement une maison d’habitation. La cliente remercie Hekima et ses partenaires pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu. Il sied de signaler qu’une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
The borrower is the coordinator of the credit group LA VERITE.  She is a courageous 32-year-old entrepreneur who is married and the mother of 7 children.  All her children, except the youngest one, attend school.  Her husband works as a driver for a private organization.  

She is a designer and seamstress by training and she works in a sewing shop.  She started her business using personal funds received from her husband about five years ago.  Later on, around the year 2010, she received her first loan from the microfinance institution Hekima, as additional funding.  Thanks to this activity, her children are growing up nicely, since her profits go toward savings, food and her children's education.   

She has just obtained her seventh loan cycle.  This new loan will be used to purchase sewing supplies (fabrics, lace, thread, buttons, scissors etc.).  Additionally, her ambition is to build a comfortable home.  She thanks Hekima and its partners for helping low-income women gain independence.  It is worth noting that [in the photo] one of the borrowers is carrying her baby.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies (fabrics, lace, thread, buttons, scissors etc.)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Hermano Miguel  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal Hermano Miguel está formado por 7 socias, que laboran diariamente en diferentes actividades económicas las mismas que le permiten tener una mayor solvencia económica en sus hogares y así salir adelante con sus familias. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia económica del País, cuenta con hermosos lugares naturales para visitar. Nuestras socias se caracterizan por mantener su carisma siendo amables, gentiles y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Erlinda, vive por la parroquia de Yanuncay en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 24 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 7 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Vive con sus padres en una casa arrendada y comparte con ellos los gastos del hogar.
 
La Señora. Erlinda labora hace 6 meses como empleada privada, trabaja de domingo a domingo en horarios rotativos, hace un año también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de varias marcas.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 3 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos para aumentar su mercadería.

Su meta es comprarse un vehículo.

Las fotos pequeñas son de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Hermano Miguel" (Brother Michael) consists of seven members who work every day in different business activities so that they can have better financial solvency in their households and help their families get ahead. They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca, which was designated a World Heritage Site. Cuenca is the third largest city in Ecuador in terms of economic importance. This area has beautiful nature sites to visit. The members of this group are known for their charisma, but they are also friendly and gentle. They have maintained the culture and traditions of their people.

One of the members of this group is Sra. Erlinda. She lives in the parish of Yanuncay in the city of Cuenca. Erlinda is 24 years old and a single mother of two children, ages 7 and 2. Her oldest child attends school in the city. She lives with her parents in a rented house and shares in the household expenses.

For the past six months, Erlinda has worked as an employee at a private company. She works Sunday to Sunday on rotating shifts. She has also been selling cosmetics of various brands for one year. Erlinda has been a member of her Communal Bank for three years and her new loan will be invested in the purchase of cosmetics so that she can increase her inventory. Her goal is to buy a vehicle.

The smaller photos shown are of two members who were not present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Temur

texts.en:
Temur is 40 years old. He lives in a small village of Khelvachauri District. Temur lives with his family: his wife, Darejan, parents (pensioners) and four children (10, 11, 14 and 15 years old). All four children go to school. Temur is a truck driver. He is busy with transportation of various goods, mainly construction materials. Along with his main job, Temur is actively involved in the family agricultural business. They have a dairy farm with 2 milk cows. Darejan produces cheese and sells on average 30 kg of this product per month in the village. Also the family has 1.5 hectare of land, where they grow vegetables and fruits. Temur sells harvested products to local greengrocery products retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 1200 Laris. 
	
Temur requested credit for purchasing a mini tractor. He will use it for tilling his own land, as well as plots of neighbor farmers. He will be paid for provided service. The income of the family will increase. Temur and Darejan will be able to create better living conditions for their four children.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-tractor

loans.name: Chirimira

texts.en:
Chirimira is a 26-year-old married man with two children who are still too young to be enrolled in school. He has rented a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Chirimira operates a green grocery from his home and sells to his neighbors. He narrates that his business is still in its initial stages, though he dreams of opening a retail shop in future. He spends more on food and rent over the month, and he describes seasonality and high market competition to be his major challenges.

With the loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), he intends to purchase fruits and vegetables for his grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for his grocery store.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena tiene 58 años, es una mujer muy sencilla que vive en compañía de Pedro, su esposo, desde hace 35 años. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero sólo cuidan de 4 de ellos, todos menores de edad. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el anexo de San Pedro de Saño.  

Desde que formó su familia comenzó a trabajar en diferentes actividades, todo ello para el sustento de su hogar. Como mujer del campo, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y habas en sus propios terrenos agrícolas. A diferencia de los demás agricultores, ella centra sus ventas en diferentes zonas según el precio y la demanda, inclusive viaja a donde los comerciantes de alimentos le paguen mayor precio por sus cosechas. Durante sus viajes se ingenió para vender, a la vez, animales menores y semillas para la germinación. Y como si fuera poco, tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, todo esto gracias a su disposición para el trabajo. Ahora espera mejorar sus cultivos, ya que sabe que depende de la calidad su ganancia. 

Ella pertenece al grupo “San Pedro” y éste es el crédito número 21 que tiene con MFP, donde se siente contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. 

Elena invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Elena, age 58, is a modest woman who lives with Pedro, her husband of 35 years. They have eight children, but only four of them are dependents who are still under their care. Elena and her family live in their own home, which is located in the annex of San Pedro de Saño.

Ever since she started her family, Elena has worked in different business activities in order to sustain her household. As a rural woman, she grows corn and beans on her own farmland. Unlike other farmers, she focuses her sales in different areas based on price and demand. One strategy is to travel to wherever food vendors are willing to pay the highest price for her crops. During these trips, she also manages to sell small animals and seeds for planting. Last but not least, she also manages a grocery store in her home. All of these businesses are possible because of her willingness to work. Now she hopes to improve her crops, but that goal will depend on the level of her earnings.

Elena is a member of the San Pedro Communal Bank and will be receiving her 21st loan with MFP. She is pleased to know that she will have the financial support required to advance her business. Elena promises to be punctual with her payments. She will invest the requested funds in the purchase of basic necessity products for her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is 37 years old, married and has three children in school.  To earn a living for his family, he supplies bread mainly to retail shops.  He has been in the business for 10 years and has employed three people. He works hard in his business to provide for his family. He has benefited from Faulu Kenya because of the financial support.

Hassan has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy bread.

loans.use: To buy bread to sell

loans.name: Tengiz

texts.en:
Tengiz is 43 years old. He lives in a small village in Khelvachauri District with his family: his wife, Lamzira, his two sons (17 and 16 years old) and his father (pensioner). Both children go to school. Tengiz earns a living through agricultural business. His family has a dairy farm with two milk cows. Lamzira produces cheese and sells on average 30 kg of this product per month in the village. In addition, the family has 0.8 hectares of land where they grow vegetables and fruits. Tengiz sells harvested products at the local open market to local greengrocery retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris, including the monthly pension of Tengiz’s father. 

Tengiz requested a loan to purchase a mini-tractor. He will use it for tilling his own land, as well as the plots of neighboring farmers. He will be paid for this service. The income of the family will increase. Tengiz and Lamzira will be able to purchase additional household goods to improve their living conditions in the mountainous village.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-tractor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a power saw

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a woman with three children who are all attending school. She lives in a rental house that has both electricity and piped water. Janet sells new clothes and shoes door-to-door, mostly to her neighbors. She has been in this business for the last three years and aspires to open a retail shop in the future. She describes the high cost of transport to be her major drawback. She joined Yehu to get access to capital to boost her business. She plans to use the loan of KSH 20,000 to add stock of clothes and shoes.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Archil

texts.en:
Archil is 45 years old. He lives in Lunchkhuti District with his family: his wife, Khatuna, and two sons (5 and 4 years old). Khatuna is a housewife. Archil leads the agricultural business of the family, which is the main source of income for the family. In particular, the family has a dairy farm with six milk cows. Archil produces traditional cheese and sells on average 90 kg of this product per month in the local market. Along with the dairy, the family owns a pig farm with 2 pigs and 10 piglets. Archil sells on average 15 piglets per month in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 450 Laris.

Archil requested a loan to purchase two 6- or 7-month-old buffalo. He will raise them and after 6 or 7 months, when they start milking, Archil will use their milk for production of yogurt, which is about 40% more expensive than the same product made with cow's milk. Archil will sell the yogurt he produces at the local open market as well. The income of the family will increase and Archil will be able to improve the living conditions of his family members.

loans.use: to purchase two buffalo

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josphine is 41 years old, married and has three children. She sells sisal ropes to earn a living.  She has been in the business for only one year.  She also does farming to supplement her income. Through Faulu Kenya, she was able to improve her farming business and managed to get capital to start a business selling ropes. Josphine hopes to grow her business in the future. She needs 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sisal ropes.

loans.use: To buy sisal ropes

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is taking another loan of KSH 20,000 to expand her existing business. With the loan, she intends to purchase wheat flour, rice, and sugar. Since the last loan, her business has grown, she has made several customers and her living standards have improved.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Otar

texts.en:
Otar is 31 years old. He lives in a village in the Lanchkhuti District with his family: his wife, Tamar, and two sons (9 and 8 years old). His children go to school. Otar is leading the agricultural business of the family. They have a dairy farm with four milk cows. Otar produces cheese and sells on average 60 kg of this product in the village. Along with the above-mentioned, Otar and Tamar grow potatoes and maize on the family-owned one hectare of land. They sell the harvested products at the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 410 Laris.

Otar requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and construction materials. Otar will fertilize the land and work hard to receive a good harvest in late summer. In addition, he will purchase construction materials for fixing and expanding the cattle-shed, which is already old. After repairing the shed, Otar will be able to keep more cows on the family farm. He won’t sell calves next summer; he will raise them on the farm. It will give more milk for the family. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and construction materials

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia is 40 years old, is married, and has six children. To earn a living, she sells ropes. She has been in the business for two years. She also does farming for more income generation. She has improved her business because she has been trained in business management skills.
Telesia hopes to grow her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings to buy sisal ropes.

loans.use: to buy sisal ropes

loans.name: Otar

texts.en:
Otar is 52 years old. He lives in a small village in the Kobuleti District, Seaside of Georgia. Otar lives with his wife, Manana. She is a teacher in a local school. Otar is busy with family agriculture. He grows maize, tangerines and nuts on family-owned 0.6 hectares of land. Otar harvests on average 1.4 tons of nuts, 1.5 tons of tangerines and 1.5 tons of maize. He sells the harvested products to local retailers. Otar spends most of the day on the plot. He works hard, especially in the spring season, to get a good harvest. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris.

Otar requested a loan to purchase fertilizers. After fertilizing the plot, Otar will get a better quality harvest, which will be sold for a convenient price. Otar will use the gained profit for further expansion of the family farm, to make it more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha is a 54-year-old farmer from a small village in Kobuleti District, Seaside of Georgia. He lives with his family: his wife, Mzevinar, his two daughters (29 and 20 years old) and his 19 -year-old son. Mzevinar and her elder daughter are teachers in a local school. Vazha is running the agricultural business of the family. He grows maize on 0.2 hectares of family-owned land and tangerine on 0.5 hectare of family-owned land. He sells the harvested products at the local market. Along with the above-mentioned, Vazha has a vineyard where he grows three tons of grapes per year. Vazha makes wine and sells it in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 1100 Laris.

Vazha requested a loan to start a beekeeping business. He plans to purchase 10 beehives and bee families. Vazha is experienced in this business, as years ago he used to be a beekeeper. The new business will give additional income to the family. He plans to reinvest the profit in the same business, to expand it in the future.

loans.use: to purchase 10 beehives with bee colonies

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 43 years old, married and has five children.  To earn a living, she sells cereals, mainly maize and beans.  She has been operating the business for two years and has employed one person.  She also farms to supplement her income.  Catherine has managed to boost her business through financial support from Faulu Kenya.

Catherine hopes to grow her business in the future.  She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy beans and maize.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard used his previous loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy leather for repairing shoes.  Since he took out the loan, he has managed to grow his business.  He has also grown his customer base.  His first loan is mostly repaid already.

Benard has requested for another loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy glue and leather for repairing shoes.

loans.use: to buy glue and leather for repairing shoes.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is a business man who runs a general shop where he sells fruits and vegetables, charcoal, sugar, salt, cooking fat, and maize flour. He has been in this business for seven years. He has benefited from business management trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya. This has helped him to run his business well.
Dominic hopes to expand his business in the future. He has requested a loan of  20,000 Kenya shillings to buy cabbages, tomatoes, and potatoes.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, tomatoes, and potatoes

loans.name: Irakli

texts.en:
Irakli is 22 years old. He lives in Lanchkhuti District with his parents and older sister. All the family members are involved in the family agricultural business. They have a dairy farm with six milk cows. Irakli’s mother produces cheese and sells on average 90 kg of this product to local dairy retailers. Irakli also grows potatoes on 0.2 hectare of family-owned land and cucumbers on 0.1 hectare. Irakli sells harvested products at a local market. 
Irakli requested a loan to purchase a fence for his plot to protect his cucumbers and potatoes from livestock. A big part of the loan will also be used to purchase fertilizers. He will fertilize the land and work hard during the spring and summer to get a good harvest. In late summer, he will sell harvested vegetables and the profit will be used to finance the family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and a fence

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is 28 years old and single, and works as a mixed crop farmer. He has been planting trees on a nursery bed for the past three years, making a monthly income of 10,500 Kenya Shillings (KES) which he uses to cater for his basic needs. 

Josphat is applying for his second loan with KADET LTD, after repaying his previous loan successfully. He will use the loan to purchase seedlings for planting. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will support his parents. Josphat's dream is to export his flowers in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings for planting

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 41 years old, married, and has two children.  He does photography to earn a living.  He has been in the business for 13 years.  He also does poultry farming for more income generation.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to save his money.  This is because he has been trained on financial management.

Alex hopes to expand his business in five years.  He needs a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy digital cameras.

loans.use: to buy digital cameras.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 35-year-old poultry keeping business lady.  She is married to Robinson, who is a business man. They are blessed with one child. She has been keeping poultry for the past three years with the monthly income of KES10,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first KADET LTD loan after being introduced by a staff member. Joyce will use the loan to purchase poultry feed and chicks to rear.  With the anticipated profit from the business she will buy a piece of land. Her hopes and dreams are to own a big poultry farm.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed and chicks.

loans.name: Vinicio

texts.es: El primer contacto que Vinicio tuvo con el café fue a la edad de 8 años y comenzar a ayudar a su padre fue como un juego para él debido a su corta edad. Cuando Vinicio ya era un adulto y se caso su padre le heredó una parcela para que comenzara a trabajar y de esta manera se pudiera ganar la vida para poder mantener a su esposa Margarita. Además de producir café también se dedica a producir la planta de este cultivo la cual utiliza para vender a otros productores y para sembrar en sus propias tierras, pues para él es muy importante que desde que se siembra sea un producto de calidad para que en el futuro de buenos resultados. Vinicio y su esposa tienen 5 hijos a quienes han enseñado desde pequeños a trabajar el café y de esta manera puedan también contribuir a la economía familiar. Vinicio necesita un crédito para hacer labores de limpieza en su finca y comprar fertilizante para así poder aumentar al doble su producción de café, la cual actualmente es de 6 toneladas. En base a sus años de experiencia sabe que si invierte bien el dinero tendrá muy buenos resultados con el paso del tiempo. La mayor ilusión de Vinicio y su esposa es poder darles a todos sus hijos la posibilidad de estudiar una carrera universitaria para que en el futuro tengan mayores oportunidades y un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
The first contact Vinicio had with coffee growing was when he was eight years old and began helping his father.  It was like a game for him at such a young age.  When he became an adult and got married, he inherited from his father a patch of land so he could begin working and earning a living to support his wife, Margarita.  Apart from growing coffee, he also has a coffee nursery and sells seedlings to other producers so they can grow their own crops.  For him it is very important that the quality of the product start at the planting stage to give good results.

Vinicio and his wife have five children who they have taught since they were small to work in the coffee trade.  This way, they will also be able to contribute to the family economy.  Vinicio is in need of a loan to prepare his farmland and buy fertilizer so he can double his coffee production, which is currently six tons.  With his expertise, he knows that if he invests his money wisely he will obtain good results over time.

What Vinicio and his wife desire most is to give all their children a college education so they will have more opportunities in the future and a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To prepare farmland and buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es: A diferencia de la mayoría de los productores de café, Tomasa comenzó a trabajar en las fincas de su hermano hace solo algunos años, pues él se fue a vivir a otro lugar y la dejó encargada a ella de los terrenos. Al principio fue muy difícil para ella pues es madre soltera y no tenía mucho conocimiento de cómo trabajar el café, sin embargo con el paso de los años ha aprendido mucho y en base a sus ahorros ha logrado adquirir su propio terreno. Tomasa actualmente está logrando una producción anual de 15 toneladas las cuales entrega a la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” que se encarga de exportarlas. Tomasa tuvo hace algún tiempo problemas de salud y por el momento no puede trabajar de lleno en sus fincas y para esto contrata a algunos miembros de una familia, ayudando así la economía de esta. Ella quiere aumentar su producción a 20 toneladas y sabe que para que esto sea posible es necesario realizar limpieza, sembrar nuevas plantas y utilizar fertilizantes y por eso ella quiere un crédito. Este proceso le tomará aproximadamente 3 años. Una de las principales preocupaciones de Tomasa es la salud de su madre ya que se encuentra delicada y sabe que si le va bien en el negocio del café podrá darle a ella los cuidados que necesita.
texts.en:
Unlike the majority of coffee producers, Tomasa began working on her brother's land only a few years ago.  When he went elsewhere to live, he left her in charge of the plantation.  At first, it was very difficult for her because she is a single mother and did not know much about working with coffee.  But over time she has learned plenty and, through her savings, has bought her own land.  

Currently, Tomasa is producing annually some 15 tons which she sells through the "Unión Regional de Huatusco" for export.  Some time ago Tomasa had health problems, and now she cannot work full time on the plantation, so she hires some of her relatives to help them economically.  She wants to increase production to 20 tons and knows that in order to do this she will have to prepare the land, sow new plants and use fertilizer, and thus needs the loan.  This process will take approximately three years.  One of Tomasa's main concerns is her mother, who is in poor health; so if the coffee business goes well she can provide the necessary care for her.

loans.use: To prepare her farmland, buy fertilizer and sow coffee.

loans.name: José Ignacio

texts.es: José de 52  años, es un hombre casado, padre de 4 hijos en las edades de 20 a 27 años, que inició su propio negocio desde el año 1997, pues le llamó su atención el ser independiente y generar sus propios ingresos, con los cuales sostener a su familia; por eso después de estudiar múltiples probabilidades,  decidió dedicarse a la venta de repuestos y al alquiler y mantenimiento de maquinas lavadoras, actividad con la cual le ha ido muy bien y ha crecido poco a poco. En la actualidad tiene el desafío de ampliar sus servicios de alquiler de lavadoras, para ensanchar su cobertura de clientes y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, con el cual comprará 5 maquinas, pues aun no son suficientes para responde a la demanda de su creciente clientela. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y la razón de éxito de esta inversión es su conocimiento del mercado y que esta ha sido planeada sobre su potencial demanda y la insatisfacción de muchos nuevos clientes, que se despiden de su negocio sin haber adquirido el servicio, al cual José anhela responder..
texts.en:
José, 52, is married and has four children between the ages of 20 and 27.  He started his own business in 1997 because he was attracted to the idea of being independent and generating his own income to support his family.  After giving consideration to multiple possibilities, he decided on the sale of spare parts and rental and maintenance of washing machines.  Business has gone very well and has grown little by little.  The challenge he is up against currently is being able to expand his machine rental service to reach more customers.  Therefore, he is requesting a CrediKiva loan so he can buy five machines, since he does not have enough to meet the growing demand.

This is his first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and the investment's success will be due to his market expertise and the fact that investment planning is based on market potential and the disappointment of many new customers when they were turned away without having used the service.  José wants to be able to respond to them.

loans.use: To buy five machines.

loans.name: Hoover Euclides

texts.es: Hoover es un padre de familia que nació en la hermosa provincia verde del Ecuador, Esmeraldas. Tiene 40 años y está casado con Aida. Actualmente vive en Guayaquil con su esposa y 3 hijos. Aida trabaja como empleada domestica, también vende productos por catalogo. Sus hijos estudian en la escuela pública ya que están en etapa escolar. Hoover nos cuenta que su negocio lo empezó por la necesidad de mejorar sus ingresos ya que como trabajador no obtenía el dinero necesario para su familia. No le va mal ya que tiene varios años en el mercador con lo que cuenta con clientela. El negocio es familiar porque le ayuda su esposa en su tiempo libre y sus hijos. Como dificultades nos dice que tiene las de todo sus vecinos, la delincuencia, calles no asfaltadas sobre todo en la temporada invernal. Con el préstamo va aumentar su inventario con la compra de cuadernos, libros, carpetas, cartulinas. En próximos años y con esfuerzo le gustaría tener un local más grande y mejor ubicado para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Hoover is a head of household who was born in the beautiful ,green province of Esmeraldas in Ecuador.  He is 40 years old and married to Aida.  He currently lives in Guayaquil with his wife and three children.  Aida works as a domestic employee and also sells products by catalogue.  Their children go to the public school.  Hoover tells us that he started his business out of the need to increase his income, since what he was making as an employee was not enough for the family.  After several years, business is going quite well because he has clientele.  It is a family business because he receives the help of his wife in her free time and that of his children.

The difficulties he runs into are the same ones his neighbors have: delinquency and unpaved streets, especially in the wintertime.  With the loan he will increase his stock and buy notebooks, books, folders and cardboard.  Over the next few years, and with a lot of work, he would like to expand his store and establish it in a better location to increase sales.

loans.use: To buy notebooks, books, folders, and cardboard.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Una de las cosas que a Don Miguel más le apasionan es el café pues desde que tenía 11 años comenzó a trabajar al lado de su padre en las fincas sembrando y cortando. Cuando el cumplió 22 años se independizó y empezó a trabajar en sus propias tierras al lado de su esposa Rocío, con quien tiene 4 hijos y quienes actualmente también ayudan a la producción del café. Don Miguel entre sus fincas tiene sembrada hoja de plátano que le sirve para darle sombra a sus plantas y además tiene mucha demanda en el mercado pues se utiliza para la preparación de alimentos, siendo esta una actividad que les genera ingresos extras. En la última cosecha Don Miguel y su familia lograron una producción de 13 toneladas y tiene proyectado que dentro de 4 años estará produciendo un total de 20 toneladas, pues ya tiene sembradas un total de 2000 nuevas plantas que en ese lapso de tiempo ya estarán produciendo café. Es por esto que Don Miguel necesita un crédito para comprar abono para sus fincas. Aparte de aumentar su producción de café, otra de las metas que Don Miguel tiene a futuro es iniciar junto con sus hijos una cría de ganado para poder dejarles un patrimonio a ellos y de esta forma tengan un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
One of the things Miguel is most passionate about is coffee, especially since age 11 when he began working at his father's side on the plantation, sowing and harvesting.  When he turned 22 he became independent and began working on his own farmland with his wife Rocío.  They have four children who also currently work in coffee production.  Miguel also grows banana leaves for shade on his plantation.  They are in high demand in the food making business, so this activity generates extra income.  

During the last harvest, Miguel and his family reached a production of 13 tons.  His 4-year plan is to reach a total 20 tons, since he has already planted 2,000 new seedlings which will take that long to start producing coffee.  Therefore, Miguel is in need of a loan to buy fertilizer for his land.  In addition to increasing coffee production, another goal Miguel has for himself and his children is to begin raising cattle.  This is to leave them more inheritance so they can have a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Lisstte Gisela

texts.es:
Lissette es bachiller, tiene 32 años y está casada con Walther. Vive con su familia en Guayaquil en el sector del Suburbio. Su esposo tiene 11 años trabajando bajo dependencia para el grupo KFC como auditor. Sus hijos estudian es la escuela tiene 7, 5 y 11 años de edad.
Hace 2 años aprendió la costura porque le gustaba, junto con el apoyo de su esposo decidió hacer de esto su profesión. El trabajo lo realiza sola en su domicilio, si tiene mucho trabajo contrata a otra persona para que le ayude. No tiene horario fijo pero le gusta porque está en casa y puede atender a sus hijos sin mayores problemas. Su mayor preocupación es que se enferme o sus hijos, y no pueda coser ya que aporta con la economía de su familia. El préstamo lo utilizara para la compra de materiales de confección como telas, hilos y una máquina de coser. En próximos años le gustaría abrir un negocio donde pueda exhibir sus artículos.
texts.en:
Lissette is a graduate. She is 32 and married to Walther. She lives with her family in Guayaquil in the sector of Suburbio. Her husband has been working for 11 years as auditor for the group KFC. Their children are aged 5, 7 and 11 and study at school.

Two years ago she learnt how to sew because she liked it. Together with her husband she decided to turn this into her profession. She carries out this work alone in her home. If she has a lot of work she hires another person to help her. She doesn't have a fixed timetable but she prefers this as she is at home and can look after her children without any problems. Her biggest worry is that either she or her children get sick and that she wouldn't be able to sew, as this helps towards the household finances.

She will use this loan to buy sewing materials such as fabrics, threads and a sewing machine. Over the next few years she would like to open a business where she can display the articles she makes.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads and a sewing machine

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Felisardo
