texts.es: El señor  Felisardo es una persona trabajadora y muy honesta, el esta muy  contento  de habernos  encontrado ya  que nos  comenta  que  desgraciadamente   tiene a   un familiar   enfermo  y  requiere  realizar la compra de medicamentos  pero  no  cuenta  con el capital  necesario  para  hacerlo,  ve en  el crédito la  posibilidad  de contribuir   con su  familia  al  hacerle frente  a este gasto, agradece  el  apoyo   incondicional  brindado.
texts.en: Felisardo is a hard-working and honest person. He is very happy to have found us and he comments that unfortunately he has a sick family member and he needs to buy medicine but he doesn't have the means to do so. He sees this loan as a possibility to be able to contribute so his family can cope with the cost of this medicine. He appreciates the unconditional support offered.

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Severo

texts.es: Desde hace 3 generaciones la familia de Severo se ha dedicado al café y fue su abuelo quien le inculcó a el y a sus hermanos el amor al cultivo del mismo ya que es la principal actividad económica de la zona de donde es originario. El café que Severo produce es orgánico, es decir que no utiliza fertilizantes agroquímicos y así contribuye a la conservación del medio ambiente. Durante la última cosecha Severo tuvo una producción de 4.5 toneladas y quiere hacer una renovación de sus plantas para que en los siguientes años pueda aumentar su producción, lo que le generará mayores ingresos. También necesita comprar una camioneta para hacer más fácil el traslado de su producto al centro de acopio de su comunidad. Es por esto que él necesita un crédito. Severo tiene 4 hijos quienes lo ayudan a trabajar en el campo, pues además del café también cuenta con cultivos de caña para ayudar a la economía de su familia. Uno de los propósitos que él tiene es poner junto con sus hijos una granja de engorda de ganado vacuno, pues ya cuenta con un terreno con las condiciones ideales para llevar a cabo esta actividad.
texts.en:
For the past three generations Severo's family has made a living in the coffee industry. It was his grandfather who inculcated in him and his siblings the love of growing coffee, as this is the main business activity in the area where he is from. Severo's coffee crops are organic, which means that he doesn't use agrochemical fertilizers, thus contributing to the preservation of the environment. During the last harvest, Severo had a yield of 4.5 tonnes. He wants to renew his plants so that in future years he can also increase his production, which will generate higher profits.

He also needs to buy a truck with which it will be easier to transport his product to the community collection centre. This is the reason why he is asking for a loan. Severo has four children who help him working in the fields. Apart from coffee he also has sugar cane crops to help the family finances. One of his goals is to set up a cow fattening farm, together with his children. He already has a site which would be the ideal location to carry out this activity.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
Nelson  es un hombre que tiene 33 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, sin hijos solo  vive con su cónyuge  en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Nelson  vive  en el  caserío Cojal del distrito de Cayalti, departamento de Lambayeque; así mismo cuenta con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica  y el consumo de agua lo realizan a través de un pozo artezanal; también se menciona que en este distrito viven todas las  familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Nelson es a la elaboración y venta de panes, bizcochos, encimadas, otros; lo cual hace su recorrido por los caseríos aledaños en su bicicleta, donde le va muy bien en este negocio. Además se dedica a la crianza y engorde de ganado caprino,  generándole otros ingresos para cubrir gastos propios; cabe destacar que en esta actividad  de comercialización Nelson cuenta con 6 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio .Así mismo su cónyuge también le apoya en este negocio. 
Actualmente  Nelson esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/. 2000 nuevos soles que será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de harina, manteca, levadura, colorantes, vainilla)  y realizar mantenimiento de su bicicleta, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Nelson is 33.  He lives with his partner, and they have no children.  He says that the quality of life in his community is one of subsistence; most of the inhabitants are independent laborers, who practice trade, agriculture, and herding.  Nelson lives on the Cojal estate in the district of Cayalti, in the department of Lambayeque; he has basic electricity service and gets his water from an artesian well; he also tells us that all the families in his district live under these conditions.

Nelson makes and sells bread, cakes, layer cakes, and so on. He takes them around the houses nearby on his bicycle, and he does very well with his business. He also raises and fattens goats, generating from this additional income to cover his own expenses.  Nelson has six years of experience in this business, which has allowed him to build up an established clientele.  His partner also helps him with the business.

Nelson is now seeking a new loan from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of S/. 2000 new soles ($775), which will be used as working capital (to buy flour, butter, yeast, coloring, vanilla) and to repair his bicycle.  His business is very profitable in this area, and he hopes over time to keep improving his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his bakery business.

loans.name: Ishara Group

texts.fr: La cliente, trésorière de l’association d’affaire Ishara, Femme courageuse, infatigable, entrepreneur,  âgée de 40 ans, mère de 8 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle est  vendeuse des  petits articles (Pétrole, Riz, sucres, Fanta, savons, sels, épices, etc.) au long de la rue donnant accès aux avenues populaires.  Son mari  est vendeur de pneus et pare-brises de véhicules. Elle commença son business avec le fonds propre reçu de son mari. Alors, elle bénéficia le crédit de l’IMF Hekima pour fonds additionnels. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et scolarité pour ses enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  15eme  cycle de crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires évoluent positivement. Toute fois, Grace aux crédits de Hekima, elle a réalisé des équipements ménagers importants pour sa famille (casseroles, bassin, thermos, etc.). Ainsi, ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  5 bidons de Pétrole, 100 kg de Riz, 25 kg de sucres,1 casier de Fanta, savons, sels, épices, 3 bidons d’huile et autres divers. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir confortablement et faire une surprise cadeau à son mari en lui payant une ’’ parcelle de souvenir résultant des crédits de l'IMF Hekima’’. La cliente remercie Hekima et ses partenaires pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
The client is the treasurer of the business association Ishara. She is a brave and indefatigable woman, an 40-year-old entrepreneur and the mother of 8 children who are all studying. She sells small goods (petrol, rice, sugar, Fanta, soap, salt, spices, etc.) on the side of a road leading to popular thoroughfares. Her husband sells tyres and windscreens.

She started her business with capital received from her husband and then got additional funds in the form of loans from IMF Hekima. The profits from her business are used to build savings and pay her children's food and education expenses. She has just received her 15th loan. Over time, this customer has seen her business prosper positively and, thanks to Hekima's loans, has managed to buy important household equipment for her family (pans, basin, thermos, etc.).

She will use the new loan to buy 5 cans of petrol, 100 kg of rice, 25 kg of sugar, 1 case of Fanta, soaps, salts, spaces, 3 cans of oil and various other products. She would like to see her children grow up comfortably, and she would like to give her husband a surprise present to remind him of the loans from the microfinance institution Hekima.

The customer thanks Hekima for its actions to empower women with lower incomes.
Note: some clients are holding their babies in the picture.

loans.use: to buy 5 cans of petrol, 100 kg of rice, 25 kg of sugar, 1 case of Fanta, soaps, salts, spaces, 3 cans of oil and various other products.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Union Y Desarrollo 1 Group

texts.en:
Griselda is one of the members of the Union y Desarrollo 1 (Unite and Development) group located in the town of Hato Mayor whose economy depends on farming. It is one of the most rural towns in the Dominican Republic. She is a single mother with three children. She lives with her children and her long-term partner. Griselda tells us that her most difficult challenge is to work hard and to take her family what they need. She does this by selling her products by walking and visiting different communities.

Griselda has been selling miscellaneous products for around five years. She started her business with her own savings. She is receiving her 8th loan from Esperanza Internacional after having paid off her previous loans satisfactorily and thereby having taken a step towards the growth of her business. She is planning to invest her new loan in the purchase of different cosmetics, hair and beauty products. Griselda plans to use her profits to save and invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products like cosmetics, hair and beauty items.

loans.name: Amor Y Paz De Dios 2 Group

texts.en:
Elena is the coordinator of a group called Amor y Paz en Dios (Love and Peace in God) 2. She lives with her long-term partner.  She is the mother of six children, but they are not living together with their parents. This group is located in the rural areas surrounding El Seybo. They all live in a rural community, surrounded by sugarcane fields on the outskirts of the city.

Elena started her business with her own savings. Having promptly repaid her previous loans, she is excited to be taking her eleventh loan from Esperanza, which she will invest in her business to buy fruit, sugar, yucca, cooking oil, etc. She sells natural fruit juices and chulitos (dough made from yucca that is filled with meat or cheese and then fried).  She is planning to use her profits to build her house and further develop her business.

Elena says that her most difficult challenges have been her economic problems and health. Meanwhile, she plans to continue attending her church.

loans.use: To buy fruit, sugar, yucca, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Lunsar Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Lunsar” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 800,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each in the group in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Yeabu is the leader of this group. Yeabu is forty-five-years-old, married with three children who  are no longer attending school. Yeabu sells market-food – tomatoes, margi (used to give suace a sweet taste), onions, pepper, salt, flour, beans, oil, etc. She has been a businesswoman for the past twenty-five years now. With the help of this loan, Yeabu will invest in her business by buying tomatoes, margi, onions, pepper, salt, flour, beans, oil, etc., in large quantities to expand her business. 

(Also included in the left of the photo is loan officer Rosaline handing over the loan to the borrowers).

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, margi, onions, pepper, salt, flour, beans, oil, etc., in large quantities to expand her business.

loans.name: Mango Group

texts.en:
Somoe, who is in her late 30s is single with three children. Two of them attend school and another one is a baby. She has been running several businesses as a  food vendor; selling fish and fruits and vegetables for eight years now. She works from 10.00 am to 10.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 4th loan from Tujijenge  Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock the missing items, household expenses and has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to  buy more stocks of food, fish and fruits and vegetables to resell. Her dream is to one day be able to own a Hotel.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Mango" which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of food, fish and fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Emilio Bernabé

texts.es:
Emilio actualmente tiene su propio negocio, donde desempeña el cargo de mecánico en el municipio de el sauce, actualmente repara Motocicleta que llegan a su propio taller, es un joven con espíritu de superación en la vida cuenta con tres hijos bajo su cargo, el cual tuvo la oportunidad de conocer  que Ceprodel apoyaba a este tipo de persona. 

Por esta razón,  se presentó para solicitar un crédito para la compra de: Cerámica para el mejoramiento del piso de su vivienda, ya que esto le permitirá vivir en mejores condiciones con su familia, donde para él es de gran importancia el crédito porque ayuda al desarrollo familiar.
texts.en:
Currently Emilio runs his own business, in which he works as a mechanic in the town of El Sauce. Each day he repairs motorcycles that are brought in to his workshop. He is a young man with a strong spirit, who takes a can-do attitude in life. He is a father and provider to his three children, which has given him the opportunity to discover that Ceprodel provides support for people such as himself.

Consequently, he has come to apply for a loan to buy ceramics in order to improve the flooring within his home, as this will allow him to provide better living conditions for himself and his family. For him, the loan is hugely important because it will help with his family to develop.

loans.use: To buy ceramics for re-flooring his home

loans.name: Adrien

texts.en:
Adrien is 32 years old and is single. He owns a bicycle repair business and his business is open from 7 am to 6 every day each week. 

Adrien has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more spare parts for bicycles to repair. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and he will be able to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts for bicycles to repair.

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is 31 years old and is married with four children. He owns a pub business selling soft drinks such as: Fanta, juice, water and so on and food (beans, rice, potatoes, meat, etc.). His business is open from 7 am to 8 pm each day. He currently employs one person to help him. 

Theoneste has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more crates of bottles to use in his pub for getting more profits from in his soft drinks. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future, to reinvest in his business and he will be able to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more crates of bottles to use in his pub for getting more profits from his soft drinks.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Essi est une femme de 23ans. Elle est mariée à un informaticien et a 02 enfants âgés de 04 et 01an. Un enfant va à l’école. Depuis 2009, Essi a commencé par vendre de la boisson, des produits cosmétiques et alimentaires aux habitants de son quartier et aux passants dans une boutique. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et sollicite ce premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter des boissons, des produits cosmétiques et des mèches. Elle voudrait épargner les profits et avoir une grande boutique de liqueurs.
texts.en: Essi is a 23-year-old woman, who is married to an IT worker and has two children aged four and one. One of her children goes to school. Since 2009 Essi has sold drinks, cosmetics and foodstuffs to the people who live in her neighborhood and passers-by who visit her store. She gets her supplies from Lomé, and has requested her first loan from WAGES to purchase drinks, cosmetics and hair extensions. Essi would like to save the profit she makes and one day open a large liquor store.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Sikilo Ouest Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sikilo   est né depuis la création du banc villageois portant le même nom en 1998. Il est composé de 22 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame  Gora, assise à l’extrême droite de la photo ayant la main levée est l'emprunteur vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 45 ans, est mariée et mère de 04 enfants : 01 garçon et 03 filles. Elle s’active dans le commerce de tissus, de draps de lit, de robes. Elle s’approvisionne à partir des  autres régions du pays pour la revente dans sa localité. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant des années.

Avec les bénéfices que cette activité génère, elle compte dans le futur ouvrir une boutique de cosmétique dans son quartier qu’elle mettra à la disposition de son garçon.
texts.en:
The Sikilo group was born from the creation of a banc villageois of the same name in 1998, and comprises 22 women who all live in the same neighborhood. The main activity carried out by these women is small-scale retail.
Gora, who is seated on the extreme right of the photo with her hand raised, is the lead borrower of this group. She is 45 years of age, and is a married mother of four children (one boy and three girls). She sells fabrics, sheets and dresses, and gets her supplies from other regions in the country to sell them in her town. She has carried out this activity for many years, so has lots of good experience.
Gora plans to use the profit generated by her work to open a cosmetic store in her neighborhood, which she will make available for her son in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fabric to sell in her town

loans.name: Oluwa

texts.fr:
Oluwa est une femme âgé(e) de 28 ans. Elle est célibataire.
Oluwa travaille comme revendeuse d’objets plastiques depuis 2008. Elle exerce l’activité dans une boutique et s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Oluwa a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des objets plastiques. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité, se marier et avoir des enfants.
texts.en:
Oluwa is a single woman aged 28.
She has worked in the sale of plastic items since 2008, carries out her activity in a store and obtains her supplies from Lomé.
Oluwa has asked for this first loan from WAGES to purchase plastic items. Her plans for the future are to reinvest profit in her activity, get married and have children.

loans.use: To buy plastic items

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy rice, palm oil, foo-foo, fish, etc. in bulk for her business

loans.name: Carina Bertha

texts.es:
Carina es una joven de 26 años de edad, es madre de un pequeño de 6 años de edad, el cual se encuentra estudiando el primer año de educación primaria, el es su razón de vivir y sobre todo el motor para salir adelante y seguir creciendo cada día; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, por sus atractivos turísticos como las “Islas Ballestas” y el “Candelabro de Paracas”; cuando Carina dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear con si hijo y en oportunidades aprovecha para disfrutar de su platillo favorito el cual es el riquísimo “Cau Cau; ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Hotelería y Turismo.

Co mucho entusiasmo Carina trabaja diariamente en su negocio de Bazar, que es una especie de tienda en la cual se vende diversos productos como regalos, productos de uso personal, peluches, entre otros; ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes de manera diaria; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es  muy amable y su negocio se ubica en una zona céntrica.

Carina está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá compra mas mercadería para su negocio como peluches, productos de belleza, juguetes, entre otros, lo que le permitirá tener mayores productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos, así ella podrá seguir trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo y estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Carina, 26 years old, is a mother to her 6 year old son, who is in his first year of primary school. He is the light of her life and, most of all, he is the motivating force which propels her onwards each day. Her home is located in the city of Pisco, a city which is characterised by its warm climate and tourist attractions, such as the Ballesta Islands and the Candelabra Geoglyph. In her free time, Carina enjoys walking with her son and taking the opportunity to savour her favourite local food, the incredibly tasty "Cau Cau" (a stew made from beef, tripe and potatoes). She has completed her secondary school studies but she would have liked to continue to study Tourism and Hospitality.

Each day Carina works with great enthusiasm at her market stall, which is a type of shop selling a diverse range of products such as gifts, personal hygiene products and wigs, among other items. She dedicates herself to her business for around 10 hours each day and she sees up to 30 clients on a daily basis. She believes that the reason her business is going well is because she is pleasant to her customers and she is located in a central spot.

Carina is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business such as wigs, beauty products and toys among other items, which will enable her to have more stock to offer to her customers and to improve her income. Consequently, she will be able to continue working towards realising her greatest dream: To provide her son with a good education and to study for a university degree.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Saiberia Group

texts.en:
Beatha, who is in her early 20s, is married with two children, one of whom goes to school. She has been running two businesses, a salon and a retail shop, for one year now. She works from 7 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.
This will be her first loan from Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use to increase her retail shop inventory and to purchase salon equipment. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.
Beatha will share this loan with her loan group "Saiberia," which has a total of 11 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase retail shop inventory and purchase salon equipment.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 38-year-old fish seller with four children between 10 and 17 years old. Her husband is a fisherman. She has lived in a semi-detached home with the family in Teshie since she was born.

She sells smoked fish at her residence and at the market. She has been in this business for seven years.

This is her forth loan with ID Ghana. She has taken an amount of 500 Ghana cedis (GHS) to buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy fish for sale.

loans.name: Noyaa Group

texts.en:
The name of the group is Noyaa and the group leader’s name is Emmanuel. There are five members in the group and they are all from Teshie. 

Emmanuel is a 58-year-old kenkey (fermented maize paste) seller with a child age 15 years old. His wife is a trader. He has lived in a single-room, self-contained apartment with the family in Teshie since he was born.

He sells Kenkey at his residence and he has been in this business for 10 years.

This is his fifth loan with ID Ghana. He has taken this loan to buy more maize to prepare kenkey to sell.

His future business plan is to buy a water poly-tank to sell water.

loans.use: To buy more maize to prepare kenkey to sell.

loans.name: Sabentee Group

texts.en:
Aminata is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Aminata was born in a village called Gbonkomara, in northern Sierra Leone. She is 56 years old. Aminata is married and has six children, three of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. 

Aminata sells soap, palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), rice, etc. She has been a businesswoman for 20 years now. 

With the help of this loan, Aminata and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Aminata will use her share of the loan to buy soap, palm oil, rice, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

(Also included in the photo, on the right, is loan officer Rosaline, handing the loan amount to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy soap, palm oil, rice, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Uhuru Group

texts.en:
Dora, who is in her mid 30s, is divorced and has three children, all of whom are in school. She has been a food vendor for two years now. She works from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Dora's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She would like a loan so she can buy more food to sell in her food stall. Her dream is to one day be able to own a hotel.

Dora will share this loan with her loan group Uhuru, which has a total of 13 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more food to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Tension Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tension” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Lunsar, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 
The leader of this group is Yeabu. Yeabu is 35 and was born in northern Sierra Leone. She is married and has five children who attend primary school. Yeabu sells items such as fish, palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), rice, etc. She has been a professional businesswoman for 15 years now. Yeabu has requested this loan in order to buy fish, palm oil, rice, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock. 
Also shown on the right of the photo is the loan officer Rosaline handing over the loan to the borrowers.

loans.use: to buy fish, palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), rice, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Arco Iris Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ARCO IRIS” iniciará su cuarto ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva, donde la señora Claudia es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de papa, venta de comida, atención de salón de belleza, costura, venta de dulces, venta de ambientadores, venta de camas, tejido de chompas a mano.

La señora Claudia, indica que  hace siete meses que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ambientadores que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de sus madres.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la aumentar su capital (compra de ambientadores)  mismo que comprará de las ferias y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta todos los servicios.
texts.en:
The "ARCO IRIS" (RAINBOW) Communal Bank is beginning its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Regional Centre. The group is made up of 8 members and is headed by a board of directors, of which Claudia is their president. The Communal Bank members' businesses are varied, and among them there are: potato sales, food sales, a beautician, a seamstress, sweet sales, air freshener sales, bed sales and hand-knitted jersey sales.

Claudia tells us that she joined the group 7 months ago, following an invitation by her friend to do so. Currently, she runs a business selling air fresheners and she has been doing this for many years. She learned her trade from her parents.

The loan that she is applying for will be invested as capital to purchase air fresheners, which she will buy at the markets to later sell at her own sales stand. This business helps her to support her family as she is married with one child.

When asked what it is that she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes all of their services.

loans.use: To buy air fresheners.

loans.name: Restauracion 1 Group

texts.en:
Santa is the coordinator of her group Restauracion (Restoration) 1. This group is located in Hato Mayor, a rural town where the economy is based around agriculture. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children. Santa is excited to be taking her thirteenth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans. She runs a business selling cosmetics.

Santa started her business with the first loan she received from Esperanza. She is planning to invest her new loan in the purchase of cosmetics from different brands. She tells us that her most difficult challenge has been to establish a sustainable business. She will use the profits to save for her long-term dream of owning her own salon. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Tamarrana Group

texts.en:
Emma is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Emma was born in Lunsar, in northern Sierra Leone, 40 years ago. She is married and has six children – one in primary school, three in secondary school and two in college. 

For more than 20 years now, Emma has been a businesswoman. She is currently selling items such as sugar, flour, canned foods, etc. With the help of this loan, Emma will be able to expand her business, make more sales and consequently improve her living conditions. She will use her share of the loan  to expand her business; she will buy the mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock. 

(Also included in the photo, on the right, is loan officer Rosaline handing over the loan amount to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, canned foods, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy is 28 years old and married. She has three children, ranging from 1 month to 7 years old. Previously she was involved in the fish-processing industry. However, she decided to start selling charcoal and has been doing this for the past two years. Her business is in a busy and marketable area.

Emmy says her biggest challenges are transportation costs. She plans to use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy additional bags of charcoal to increase her stock so as to meet the customer demand. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. Emmy plans to be a supplier of charcoal and venture into a boutique business.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Dona Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DONA est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et exercent leurs activités dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe du nom de Houénoumè est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Houénoumè est âgée de 52 ans et vit au Bénin. Houénoumè est mariée à un forgeron du nom de Louis. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés dont trois à leur charge. Houénoumè n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Houénoumè vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différents besoins de la famille. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille, Houénoumè vend des bois de chauffage, du charbon de bois et divers autres articles par le système de distribution depuis une quinzaine d'année. Houénoumè s’approvisionne au Benin et parfois au Nigeria. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Houénoumè sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DONA. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The DONA group is comprised of three friends who work together in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is called Houénoumè, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. Houénoumè is 52 years of age, married to a blacksmith called Louis and lives in Benin. The couple has five children (all at school), three of whom are in their care. Houénoumè did not attend school and lives with her children and husband, and both she and her husband are responsible for the household expenses. To better cover her family’s various needs, Houénoumè has sold and distributed firewood, charcoal and miscellaneous articles for 15 years. She gets her supplies from Benin and, from time to time, from Nigeria. To meet the demands of her ever-growing customer base, Houénoumè has asked for a fifth loan from Alidé along with the other members of the DONA group. All the loans they received in the past have been successfully repaid.

loans.use: To purchase firewood.

loans.name: Latré

texts.fr:
Latré est une femme âgé(e) de 34ans. Elle a 02 enfants tous scolarisés.  Le premier a 14ans et le dernier 12ans.Latré travaille comme revendeuse de mèches depuis 2008. Elle vend seule à domicile et achète ses produits à Lomé. 
Latré a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des mèches. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et assurer le bien être des enfants.
texts.en:
Latré is a 34-year-old woman with two children, both of whom go to school. Her children are aged 14 and 12. Latré has worked selling hair extensions since 2008, which she buys in Lomé and sells by herself from home.
Latré has asked for her first loan from WAGES to purchase hair extensions. She plans to reinvest her profit in her business and to provide for the wellbeing of her children.

loans.use: To purchase hair extensions

loans.name: Mawuwegnidaho Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAWUWEGNIDAHO est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui s'approvisionnent dans un même endroit. La représentante du groupe du nom de Amirath Olaséwayou Tatiana est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Amirath Olaséwayou Tatiana est âgée de 24 ans et vit au Bénin. Amirath Olaséwayou Tatiana a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Amirath Olaséwayou Tatiana est mariée à un certain Hugues et n'a pas d'enfant. Amirath Olaséwayou Tatiana vit ensemble avec son mari. Pour faire face à ses diverses charges, Amirath Olaséwayou Tatiana vend divers articles et des canaris par le système de distribution depuis près de cinq ans. Amirath Olaséwayou Tatiana s’approvisionne dans une ville du Benin. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Amirath Olaséwayou Tatiana sollicite pour une deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAWUWEGNIDAHO. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The Mawuwegnidaho group is comprised of three friends who all get their supplies from the same place. The group’s representative is called Amirath Olaséwayou Tatiana, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. Amirath Olaséwayou Tatiana is 24 years of age, lives in Benin and left her studies when she was in high school. She is married to and lives with Hugues, and they have no children. To cover her expenses, Amirath Olaséwayou Tatiana sells and distributes miscellaneous articles and pottery containers (known as "canaris") which she obtains from a town in Benin, and has done so for almost five years. To meet the needs of her ever-growing customer base, Amirath Olaséwayou Tatiana has asked for a second loan from Alidé along with the other members of the Mawuwegnidaho group. The loan they received in the past was successfully repaid.

loans.use: To purchase pottery containers.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi est un homme de 31ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse de produits cosmétiques et a 03 enfants dont 02 à l’école. Le premier a 12ans et le dernier 03ans. Pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille, il a commencé par vendre en 2001 de la friperie. 04 personnes l’aident dans l’exercice de son activité et il s’approvisionne à Lomé. Sa difficulté principale est la mévente. Il sollicite ce premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter des bal de friperie. Il veut élargir et multiplier ses lieux de vente et voir ses membres de famille s’épanouir.
texts.en:
Koffi is 31 years old. He is married to a reseller of cosmetic products, and the couple have three children aged 3 to 12, two of them in school. 

Koffi started selling second-hand clothing in 2001 to support his family. He has four helpers to assist him in this activity. He buys his merchandise in Lomé. His main difficulty is a drop in sales.

He is seeking his first loan from WAGES to buy bales of used clothing. He wants to expand his business and add new locations. He also wants to ensure his family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 35-year-old conservative woman. She asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Sarah has six children. Her husband is a taxi driver.

To help her husband in supporting the family, Sarah used her talent to turn a hobby into a business, making embroidery hangings. She has applied for this loan to buy beads to start decorating bags besides the other embroidered items. She also wants to apply to participate in crafts exhibitions to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy beads decorate bags besides the other embroidered items.

loans.name: Vibula Group

texts.en:
Seifu, who is in his mid 20s, is married and has two children. He has been running a kiosk business for eight months now. He works from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to replace missing items to resell and has paid back all his loans successfully. He wants a loan to buy more stock of sugar, salt, wheat flour, baking flour, water, soda and juice. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house. 

He will share this loan with hius loan group "Vibula" which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, salt, wheat flour, baking flour, water, soda and juice.

loans.name: Talaye

texts.en:
Talaye is a 56-year-old widow. She has three sons; one of them is married.

Talaye has been planting and selling decorative plants and trees at her house. She even bought a number of pots to plant different type of plants.

Now Talaye has applied for this loan in order to buy new pots for planting hanging plants and flowers.

loans.use: to buy new pots for planting hanging plants and flowers.

loans.name: Mervat

texts.en:
Mervat is a 26-year-old married conservative lady. She asked her husband to take her place in the photo.
 
Mervat is a mother of two boys. Her father-in-law owns a clothing store where her husband works. Using their experience, she decided to start her own business so she can open another clothing store of her own.

In the meantime, Mervat’s business is based at home. She bought clothes with the help of her husband and started selling at home. She has applied for this loan to add accessories beside clothes. Because Mervat is under 30, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to add accessories to her clothes sales.

loans.name: Ruqaya

texts.en:
Ruqaya, a 28-year-old single lady. She is the only sister for five brothers, and all of them are serving in the military.

Being raised among boys has helped her to get an independent personality. Four years ago, she started her own business selling clothes, and during this time she was able to open a shop for clothing sales, decorate it, and bring in a good collection of clothes.

Now Ruqaya has applied for this youth loan to add more spring and summer clothes to the store.

loans.use: to add more spring and summer clothes to the store.

loans.name: Ayda

texts.en:
Ayda is a 37-year-old housewife, a mother for three sons and a daughter. Her husband is a plumber.

Ayda started a home products sale business at home. She brought few items as a start and applied for this loan to bring more. 

Ayda hopes that she can open a small store for selling home products in the future.

loans.use: to bring in more home products to sell.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Cándida, tiene 69 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad, vive con su esposo y uno de sus hijos en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula.
Doña Cándida, anteriormente trabajaba como maestra y la falta de empleo la hizo tomar la decisión de establecer su propia fuente de ingresos para aportar al hogar como ser una pulpería para vender productos alimenticios de consumo diario, ella ofrece a sus clientes granos básicos, lácteos, carnes, pan, refrescos, harina, huevos, etc. este negocio lo tiene desde hace 10 años y ha perseverado para lograr mantenerlo y obtener los ingresos necesarios para su familia.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo de 10,000.00 lempiras para surtir de productos que le hacen falta en la pulpería como granos básicos, carnes, huevos, lácteos, etc. y satisfacer a los clientes.
Su meta es mantener el negocio surtido para que le genere un ingreso seguro para su familia.
texts.en:
Cándida, age 69, is married and has four adult children.  She lives with her husband and one of her children in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.  

Cándida previously worked as a teacher, but the lack of employment made her decide to establish her own source of income.  She decided to do this in order to contribute to her household.  She opened a grocery store in order to sell food staples like basic grains, dairy products, meat, bread, soft drinks, flour, and eggs, etc.  She has had this business for ten years.  She has persevered in order to succeed at maintaining it and getting the income needed for her family. 

She is requesting a loan for 10,000.00 lempiras to stock the products that she needs in her store.  She will buy things like basic grains, meat, eggs, and dairy products, etc. to satisfy her customers.

Her goal is to keep her business stocked in order to generate a secure income for her family.

loans.use: to buy food products like  basic grains, dairy products, meat, bread, soft drinks, flour, and eggs, etc. to sell at her store.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Akossiwa est une femme âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée å un pasteur. Elle n’a pas d’enfants.  
Akossiwa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle vend des tissus chemise et pantalon  pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Akossiwa a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des tissus chemise et pantalon. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Akossiwa voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is a 31-year-old woman.  She is married to a pastor and has no children.

Akossiva has been working as a reseller since 2007.  She sells shirts and pants fabrics, in her shop, to a diverse group of customers. She buys her goods in Lomé and works alone.  Her main challenge is that she is currently out of stock.

Akossiva has requested her second loan from WAGES for the purchase of shirts and pants fabrics.  She wants to reinvest in her activity.

In the coming years, Akossiva would like to increase the size of her business.  She says that, with the profits, she plans to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Sorbeh Iii Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Sorbeh III” group from Lunsar, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Zainab is the leader of this group. The 45-year-old woman is married and has two children attending primary and secondary schools. Zainab has been a businesswoman for 25 years now. Currently, she sells medicines. With her share of this loan, she will buy a large quantity of medicines to add to her current ones. 

(Also included in the right of the photo is loan officer Rosaline handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of medicines to add to her current ones.

loans.name: Ayda

texts.en:
Ayda is a 42-year-old married woman who has three sons and a daughter.

A few years ago, Ayda started a beauty salon at home. First she only did make up for the ladies who came. Then she started cutting their hair. Now Ayda has opened her own beauty salon and started doing many hairstyles.
 
She has applied for this loan in order to bring more equipment to the salon and more hairdryers. She also wants to recruit more people so she can open a bridal section in the future.

loans.use: to bring more equipment and more hairdryers to the salon.

loans.name: Jesus Es Prosperidad 2 Group

texts.en:
Yohanna is the coordinator of her group Jesus es Prosperidad 2 (Jesus is Prosperity). Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to raise her children. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying cooking and spending time with her family.

Yohanna is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for three years, starting with her first loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothes, underwear, cosmetics and shoes. She will use the profits to save and supply her family's needs. She is dreaming to have her own house and to improve her business.

This Esperanza associate came to us because, after having other loans, she found the Esperanza program in her community and prefers our rates.

loans.use: To buy clothes, underwear, cosmetics and shoes.

loans.name: Nihad

texts.en:
Nihad is a 22-year-old single woman. She lives in Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan.

Nihad is looking to have a loan of 500 JOD so that she can buy and sell clothes.

Nihad is under 30 years old so her loan is a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy and sell clothes.

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en:
Rawan is a 21-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She lives in Madaba, Jordan.

Rawan is looking to have a loan of 500 JOD so that she can buy and sell clothes. She hopes to open her own clothes store in the future.

Rawan is under 30 years old so her loan is a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy and sell clothes.

loans.name: Cándida Paula

texts.es:
La joven Cándida paula, actualmente labora en un centro de educativo, cuenta con un hijo bajo su responsabilidad, es  soltera con espíritu de superación, actualmente se presentó a Ceprodel, con el fin de solicitar un crédito para la mejora de su vivienda ya que es de su conocimiento que Ceprodel apoya a este tipo de actividad. 

Por esta razón,  se presentó para solicitar un crédito para la compra de: Ladrillo y Cemento para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que esto le permitirá vivir en mejores condiciones con su familia, donde para él es de gran importancia el crédito porque ayuda al desarrollo familiar
texts.en:
Cándida currently works at an educational center.  She has one child for whom she is responsible.  She is single, and she has the spirit for improvement.

She came to Ceprodel in order to request a loan to make improvements to her house.   She knows that Ceprodel supports this type of activity.  That is the reason that she went to request a loan to buy bricks and cement to improve her home.  This will allow her to live with her family under better conditions.  

The loan is of great importance to her because it helps with the family development.

loans.use: to buy bricks and cement.

loans.name: Jesus Es Prosperidad 1 Group

texts.en:
Maribel is the coordinator of her group, Jesus Es Prosperidad 1 (Jesus Is Prosperity). This group is located in Santiago, an area known for tobacco and beef production. Santiago is the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. The group members are dedicated to selling clothes, food, shoes and jewelry.

Maribel lives in a simple structure with her three children and her husband, who is also her children's father. 

Maribel is excited about her sixth loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for approximately two years, starting with her first loan from Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing more clothes. With this loan, she will be able to expand her business. 

She will use the profits to save, because she wants to make one of her dreams come true: to have a clothing store. Maribel thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 42-year-old conservative woman; she asked her husband to take her place in the photo.  

Iman has five sons and daughters. Her husband has owned a mini-market for almost eight months now.  Iman want to support her husband, so she has applied for this loan in order to bring in more food products to the store to have variety and attract more customers.

loans.use: to bring in more food products to the store

loans.name: Mirian Andrea

texts.es: Mirian nació en Valencia que pertenece a la provincia de Quevedo. Como es madre soltera se traslado a vivir a Buena Fe. Tiene 35 años es bachiller y tiene un hijo. Nos cuenta que desde muy joven aprendió a ser responsable por ser madre y padre, ahora su hijo tiene 15 años y está en el colegio. Su tienda la empezó poco a poco al ver resultados fue incrementando el negocio con víveres ya que por el sector donde vive no hay muchas tiendas. Su hermana vive con ella y le ayuda en el negocio porque ella realizar labores domésticos desde las 8 am hasta las 4 pm que sale, luego de eso ella se ocupa del negocio hasta que lo cierra en la noche. Mirian no ha tenido mayores problemas por su barrio porque es conocida pero eso no quiere decir que no haya delincuencia en su sector. Con el préstamo va a comprar víveres, pollos y adecuar con perchas su tienda. A Mirian le gustaría en los próximos años abrir un restaurant, continuar con la tienda y ayudar a su hijo en la universidad.
texts.en:
Mirian was born in Valencia in the province of Quevedo.  Because she's a single mother, she moved to Buena Fe.  She's thirty-five, a high-school graduate, and has one child.  She tells us that she learned from when she was very young to be responsible in the role of mother and father.  Now her son is fifteen and in high school.  

Little by little, Mirian's store began to see results.  She grew the business with merchandise because there aren't many stores in her area.  Her sister lives with her and helps out in the business because Mirian goes out to work as a maid from 8AM to 4PM, and then works in the store until it closes at night.  Mirian has not had major problems in her neighborhood because she's well-known, but that's not to say there isn't any crime.

Mirian plans to use her loan to buy merchandise, chickens, and to put in some shelves.  In the next few years, she would like to open a restaurant, continue with the store, and help her child with college.

loans.use: to buy supplies, chickens, and shelving.

loans.name: Suha

texts.en:
Suha is a 31-year-old single lady; she has a younger brother and sister.  

Suha used to work in a clothing store, but the store had to be closed down. After that she decided to use her experience and went to the free zone area in Aqaba southern Jordan and buy a collection of clothes to sell at a higher price in her town.  

She has applied for this loan to buy more and new spring collection for all ages so she would have variety in the clothes she sells.

loans.use: to expand her inventory with a new spring collection

loans.name: Ghena

texts.en:
Applying for the first loan has helped her in attracting more people to her home food store, it added more variety to the products she used to sell.  Using the increased revenues she was able to build a new room and moved the food store from her house into it.  She also started selling more food items  than just snacks and candy.  

Now Ghena has applied again for a loan to improve the interior decoration of the store and bring in more food products.

loans.use: to improve her store's interior decoration and bring in more food products

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Marites has a shop that sells tablea or home made chocolate. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making home made chocolate bars.
Marites has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.In the future, Marites hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making tablea or home made chocolate

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Chantha is 31 years old. She is a mother of five children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for more than five years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $3 per day. Her children are still in her care and in school. In order to improve her husband’s business, Chantha is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase construction tools for her husband to use in his work. This purchase would enable her husband run his business smoothly. In the future, she would like to run a groceries store to earn extra income to support the family and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new timber house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools for her husband to use in his work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods,snacks,soap and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 45-year-old housewife who is married to a driver.  They have three daughters and a son.  

Mona wanted to help in improving her family's living conditions, so she started to sell clothes and blankets at her house.  Now that she has regular customers Mona wants to add more variety to her products.  She has applied for this loan in order to start selling lighter bed covers that are suitable for summer season.

loans.use: to add lighter bed covers to her inventory

loans.name: Rinal

texts.en:
Rinal is a 30-year-old married lady; she has two boys.  Her husband owns a supermarket.  

Rinal took few fitness courses and got a certificate to be a fitness coach, then she bought a few machines and some equipment and used her house's second floor as a gymnastics area.  

She has applied for this loan in order to buy more fitness machines so that she can make enough revenue to help her open a bigger fitness club with a spa section.

loans.use: to buy more fitness machines

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is married with 5 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Juvy is 47 years old and has 4 children who are in school.

Juvy has a fishing business in the Philippines. Juvy requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing materials.

Juvy has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Juvy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en: Sokly is 49 years old. She is a mother of five children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling desserts for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, who earns about $3 per day. Three of her children are employed. They earn about $10 per day. Due to the difficulty with her family’s transportation, Sokly is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Mary Grace has a shop that sells RTW's like t-shirts, jackets, pants and short pants. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of RTW's to sell like blouses, jackets and pants. Mary Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mary Grace hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional ready-to-wear garments like pants, jackets and t-shirts

loans.name: Andres Avelino Caceres Group

texts.en:
"Andres Avelino Caceres" is a village bank, which consists of twelve entrepreneurial women and men who live and work in Cusco. The members dedicate themselves to a variety of activities here in the southern Andean mountains of Peru. Some of them raise small animals such as chickens and guinea pigs. Others buy and sell artisanal goods, and one of the women has a business selling "chicha", a Peruvian fermented corn beverage.

One of the members, Alejandrina, is pictured wearing a pink sweater on the right side of the photo. She is 59 years old and a widow with seven children who are all fully grown and living independently. Alejandrina supports herself by selling candy in front of a school and running a small grocery store in her house. Alejandrina is requesting 1,000 Peru Nuevo Soles (PEN) from the group loan in order to purchase more candy and stock up her store with products such as beer, soda, sugar, and other products of basic necessity. She says that she looks forward to growing her business a little during this loan cycle, by increasing her merchandise and attracting more customers.

loans.use: to buy candy, beer, soda, sugar, and other products of basic necessity.

loans.name: Ulambayar

texts.en:
Ulambayar is a 29-year-old, married guy who has one son and lives with his family in an outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia that lacks basic infrastructure. He is an engineer. His spouse works as a manager and his son stays at his mother-in-law’s house. 

Ulambayar’s current house changes temperature very quickly and is so old, so he needs some renovation work. Thus, Ulambayar is requesting a 3,500,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase needed construction materials.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Maria Helen

texts.en:
Maria Helen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Maria Helen has been in this business for 28 years now. She requested a 19,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

In the future, Maria Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Ma. Paz

texts.en:
Ma. Paz is 51 years old and married with 4 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Paz has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years. Ma. Paz requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

In the future, Ma. Paz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 44 years old and married with 6 children. She earns a living farming rice in the Philippines. Luzviminda has been farming rice for 18 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Luzviminda is borrowing 23,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mamadrajab

texts.ru: Мамадрачаб житель района Яван. Ему 38 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сама он занимается животноводством. Этим видом деятельности занимается 7 лет. Мамадрачаб разводит мелко - рогатый и крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа быка, коровы и бычков.
texts.en: Mamadrajab resides in the Yavan region. He is 38 years old, married, and has four children. Mamadrajab's wife works at an orchard, while he raises livestock at home. Mamadrajab has spent the past 7 years raising cattle, goats, and sheep. He is taking this loan to purchase a bull, a cow, and a few calves.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Kulpunai

texts.ru: Кулпунай – лидер группы «Ак-жолтой», объединяющей еще 3 участников. Кулпунай 35 лет, замужем,  имеет 3 детей. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, Кулпунай занимается животноводством и полеводством.  На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имеется 6 голов коров и 0,16 га земельного надела, где она выращивает картофель и кукурузу . В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кулпунай обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Кулпунай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en: Kulpunai is the leader of the Ak-Joltoy group, which contains 3 other members. She is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children. To provide a source of income for her family, Kulpunai raises cattle and cultivates crops. Presently, her farm has 6 cows and 0.16 hectares of land where she grows potatoes and corn. In order to continue developing her business, Kulpunai has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy more cattle. She plans to invest her profits into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mateo

texts.en: Mateo is 42-year-old married man. He has 2 grown children. They live in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Mateo has been a fisherman for 8 years. He makes a monthly income of 3,000 PHP from fishing. In 2007, Mateo joined GDMPC. He has applied for a loan of 6,000 PHP in order to repair fishing materials so that he can continue fishing. Mateo hopes to earn more income and improve his living condition.

loans.use: to repair fishing materials.

loans.name: Gulzamon

texts.ru: Гулзамон на сегодняшний день занимается торговлей. Она открыла продуктовый магазин. Кроме того она занимается животноводством. Кредит берет для покупки продуктов с целью увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Currently, Gulzamon is a merchant and runs her own grocery store. She also continues to raise livestock. She is taking this loan to stock up on food products and thereby increase the volume of her sales.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis  es un hombre  que tiene  43 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con tres hijos a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Luis  vive  en el  caserío Los Laureles del distrito de Cayalti, departamento de Lambayeque; así mismo cuenta con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica; también se menciona que en este distrito viven todas las  familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Luis es al transporte público de mototaxi el recorrido lo realiza entre las zonas de Los Laureles  – Cayalti  y visciversa. Además se dedica a ofrecer servicios en tienda de agroquímicos en sus tiempos libres,  generándole otros ingresos para cubrir gastos propios; cabe destacar que en esta actividad  de transporte público Luis cuenta con 5 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio. 
Actualmente  Luis esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/. 1000 nuevos soles que será para el mantenimiento de su vehiculo (cambio de neumáticos, sistema de arrastre y cambio de aceite),  esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is a forty-three-year-old man who has a common law wife and three kids in his care.  He lives with his partner and kids in their own house.  He says that the standard of living in his community is subsistence, and most people work independently in business, farming, and livestock.  Luis lives in the hamlet of Los Laureles, Cayalti District in the department of Lambayeque.  He also has basic electrical service, and says that all the families in the district live under these conditions.  

Luis's works in motor taxi public transportation; his routes go back and forth among zones in Los Laureles and other zones in Cayalti.  In his free time, he also offers agrochemical services to make more money to cover expenses.   He notes that he has five years of experience in public transportation, which have allowed him to maintain an established clientele.  

Luis is currently seeking a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1000 soles, which he plans to use to maintain his vehicle (change the oil, tires, and suspension system); it's a very profitable business in his area and in time it's going to allow him to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain his motor taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: maintain the computers in her internet cafe and buy manure for her crops.

loans.name: Mitze

texts.en:
Mitze is 44 years old and married with one child.

Mitze works hard to provide for her family. She runs a grocery store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Mitze has borrowed and repaid thirteen loans from NWTF previously. She has been running her grocery store for 30 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Mitze aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Paquita

texts.en:
Paquita is 62 years old, married, and has five children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.  She also earns income from food and vegetable selling.  

Paquita is requesting her twentieth loan through NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional stock to sell.  Paquita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is widowed and has four children. She works very hard to provide for them.  Rosie runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 15 years.  She sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, soap, and soft drinks.

Rosie is requesting a loan for 23,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to purchase more stock to sell.  In the future Rosie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio de 64 años de edad, soltero con un hijo de 12 años de edad, vive en una aldea del municipio de Arizona, Tela, Atlántida.
Don Antonio es un señor muy trabajador se gana la vida elaborando y vendiendo tajadas de plátano en bolsa en forma de ristras. Ya tiene 2 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, anteriormente se dedicaba solo a la agricultura y por necesidad de obtener mayores ingresos para la manutención de su hijo pudo establecer su propio negocio.
Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo para comprar más insumos para elaborar las tajadas que vende en bolsitas en forma de ristra, este producto tiene buena demanda, con el préstamo anterior logro incrementar las ventas y ahora espera crecer mas. Su meta es continuar creciendo en el negocio para obtener los ingresos que le ayuden a darle una buena educación a su hijo y hacerle mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Antonio, age 64, is single and has a 12 year old son.  He lives in a village in the Arizona municipality in Tela, Atlántida.

Antonio is a very hard-working man who earns a living making and selling fried banana slices.  He sells them in bunches that are packaged in bags.  He has been doing this business activity for two years.  He used to work only in agriculture.  However, out of the necessity of earning greater income to support his son, he was able to establish his own business.

He is requesting a second loan to buy more supplies to make the fried banana slices that he sells in bunches that are packaged in bags.  There is a good demand for this product.  With his previous loan he managed to increase his sales, and he now hopes they grow even more.

His goal is to continue growing in the business in order to get the income that will help him give his son a good education and to make improvements to his house.

loans.use: to buy supplies like oil, bags, and bananas to make fried banana slices and sell them in bunches.

loans.name: Antonia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Antonia del Socorro actualmente desempeña el cargo de Maestra en un centro educativo. Es una joven soltera con dos hijo bajo su cargo, donde esto la ha motivado a seguir luchando, se le presento la oportunidad de conocer que  Ceprodel por primera vez y se dio cuenta que apoyaba a las personas con créditos para su desarrollo. 

Por esta razón,  se presentó para solicitar un crédito para la compra de Cemento, Arena y Pago de Mano de Obra, estando consciente que logrará obtener mejores condiciones de vida en su familia y saldrá adelante esto la motiva a seguir luchando en sus labores que enfrenta día a día.
texts.en:
Antonia del Socorro currently works as a schoolteacher.  She’s a single young lady with two children whom she cares for and this motivates her to forge ahead.  She learned about Ceprodel for the first time and learned that they provide loans for personal development.

She decided to apply for a loan in order to buy cement, sand, and pay for labor so that she can provide better living conditions for her family.  This motivates her to move ahead in her daily work.

loans.use: to buy building materials and pay for labor.

loans.name: Marìa Vilma

texts.es:
María  es una mujer que tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, con un hijo a su cargo,  vive con su cónyuge  en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. María vive  en el  caserío Annape del distrito de Mòrrope, departamento de Lambayeque; así mismo cuenta con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica  y el consumo de agua lo realizan a través de un pozo artezanal; también se menciona que en este distrito viven todas las  familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica María es a la compra y venta de verduras; lo cual vende en un puesto del mercado de Mòrrope, donde le va muy bien en este negocio. Además se dedica a la crianza y engorde de ganado caprino y aves de corral,  generándole otros ingresos para cubrir gastos propios; cabe destacar que en esta actividad  de comercialización María  cuenta con 2 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio .Así mismo su cónyuge también le apoya en este negocio. 
Actualmente  María esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/. 2000 nuevos soles que será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de verduras)  y realizar arreglo de sus corrales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
María is a 27-year-old single woman with one dependent child and lives with her partner in her own house.  She mentions that the quality of life in the community is of subsistence; the majority of the inhabitants are independent workers that make a living through commerce, agriculture, and livestock.  María lives in the hamlet of Annape in the district of Mórrope, department of Lambayeque; it has basic electricity service and gets water through an artesian well.  She says that all the families in this district live under these conditions.  

The work through which María makes a living is the purchase and sale of vegetables, which she sells in a stall in the market of Mórrope, where she is doing well with the business.  She also makes a living raising and fattening up goats and poultry, generating more income to cover her own costs.  It is worth noting that María has had two years of experience in this work, which has allowed her to keep her already established customers in this business.  Likewise, her partner also supports her in this work.

Now, María is asking for a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa for an amount of 2000 nuevos soles that will be used for working capital (to buy vegetables) and to arrange her pens. This is because it is a very profitable activity in the area, and which in time will allow her to go on improving her standard of living with her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to stock up her business.

loans.name: Sophors

texts.en:
Sophors is 36 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. Her mother lives with the family.  She lives in Kampot Province, Cambodia. Sophors has been involved in the agricultural business for more than 20 years with extensive experience. She grows rice and fattens up cattle. She also sells sugarcane juice to earn additional income to support the family. She earns about $3 per day. Her husband is a policeman who earns about $4 per day. 

Due to the difficulty with her family’s transportation, Sophors is requesting a loan for $1,000, which she will use to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, Sophors would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery in the Philippines. She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her bakery. Elma has been in this business for 25 years. Elma earns more income from raising chickens. Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Noël

texts.fr: Noël est âgé de 40 ans et vit au Benin. Noël n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Noël est marié à une marchande du nom de Antoinette. Le couple a six enfants à leur charge dont cinq constituent leurs propres enfants. Certains enfants sont scolarisés. Noël vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Noël mène comme activité la menuiserie dans sa région depuis seize ans. Cette activité lui permet ainsi de nourrir sa famille et de subvenir à ses besoins. Noël s’approvisionne en madriers dans une ville du Benin. Dans la quête de la meilleure satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’améliorer son activité, Noël sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Noël is 40 years old and he lives in Benin. He never went to school. He is married to a merchant named Antoinette, and the couple have six dependent children, five of them being their own. Some of the children attend school. Noël lives with his wife and their children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. 

Noël has been working locally as a carpenter for the past 16 years. This activity allows him to support himself and feed his family. He buys his lumber in a city of Benin. 

To achieve customer satisfaction and bolster his business, Noël is seeking a third loan from ALIDé. Past loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy lumber, glue and varnish.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 43 years old, married, and has four children. She works very hard to provide for them. Tita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Tita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, snack foods, milk, canned goods, etc. In the future Tita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 47 years old, married, and has three children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Virginia is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Virginia has been raising livestock for 13 years and also earns additional income from selling food. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Martha Julia

texts.es: Martha es una mujer de 37 años, madre soltera de 2 niños. Vive en Ventanas cantón de Quevedo. Su casa es propia y sus hijos asisten a la escuela. Hace 5 años empezó el negocio de venta de frutas y víveres, no se queja le va muy bien y gracias a eso puede mantener a su familia. Martha nos cuenta que si es un poco cansado ya que su día empieza a las 6 de la mañana  comprando las frutas, como son productos de corta duración la compra es diaria. Por ahora no tiene ninguna dificultad en su entorno ya que es conocida.
